</Summary></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,fr_FR," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	We are sorry, but we are sold out!</p>
<p>
	The Liferay Symposium unites thought-leaders, industry luminaries, and key engineers from around the world. Join us in Paris for a day of learning, networking, and knowledge sharing! (This conference will be conducted in both French and English.)</p>
<p>
	&nbsp;</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="fr_FR"><p>
	<span style="line-height: 1.4;">Le Symposium Liferay France réunit des leaders d'opinion, des pionniers de l'industrie et des ingénieurs clés du monde entier. Rejoignez-nous à Paris pour une journée riche en informations , privilégiant le networking et le partage des connaissances! (Cette conférence se déroulera en français et en anglais.)</span></p>
</Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	Join other developers and IT professionals at the first Liferay Dev Con in Berlin! Meet Liferay core engineers from around the globe and acquire valuable how-to's applicable to your situation. Get answers to your questions, suggest new features and use the chance to influence Liferay community guidelines and development in a unique way. There will also be plenty of time for knowledge sharing, networking and fun!&nbsp;</p>
<p>
	As an added bonus, we will be hosting an UnConference on October 8th, a day before the actual conference starts. Here, the agenda will be determined in the first session of the day and provide a great environment for knowledge sharing and focused training amongst peers. Seats are limited and based on availability.</p>
</Summary></root>

As an added bonus, we will be hosting an UnConference on October 8th, a day before the actual conference starts. Here, the agenda will be determined in the first session of the day and provide a great environment for knowledge sharing and focused training amongst peers. Seats are limited and based on availability.

summaryMap.en_US:
Join other developers and IT professionals at the first Liferay Dev Con in Berlin! Meet Liferay core engineers from around the globe and acquire valuable how-to's applicable to your situation. Get answers to your questions, suggest new features and use the chance to influence Liferay community guidelines and development in a unique way. There will also be plenty of time for knowledge sharing, networking and fun! 

As an added bonus, we will be hosting an UnConference on October 8th, a day before the actual conference starts. Here, the agenda will be determined in the first session of the day and provide a great environment for knowledge sharing and focused training amongst peers. Seats are limited and based on availability.

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p>
	Treffen Sie uns in Wien und sprechen Sie mit uns über die Wichtigkeit von Enterprise Portalen in der Kommunikation im Unternehmen, mit Geschäftspartnern, Kunden und Interessenten sowie bei der Bildung einer digitalen Business Strategie. Das Liferay Management in DACH stellt Ihnen die Strategie und die Investition von Liferay in den österreichischen Markt vor. Klicken Sie hier für mehr Informationen oder um sich kostenfrei zu registrieren. Wir freuen uns auf Sie.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	Join us in Vienna and learn how important Enterprise Portals are for your corporate communication, with business partners, customers and prospects and what value they have in your digital business strategy. The Liferay Management for the DACH regions will present the strategy and investments for the Austrian market at that event. Click for more info and free registration. We are looking forward to meeting you. (The conference language will be German)</p>
</Summary></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p>
	Das Liferay Portal Solutions Forum findet am 4. November 2014 unter dem Motto „Digitale Business Strategien für Unternehmen – bereit für den Wandel" erstmals als deutschsprachiges Forum in Darmstadt, Hessen statt. Wir laden Sie ein, sich von Anwendervorträgen, einer Live-Demo von Liferay Portal mit Strategie-Update sowie fachspezifischen Expert Exchange Groups sowie Gesprächen mit Fachkollegen, Liferay Experten und Partnern inspirieren zu lassen. Erfahren Sie, wie Sie auf Basis Liferay Portal eine digitale Business Strategie für Ihr Unternehmen umsetzen.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	The Liferay Portal Solutions Forum will be held in German this year&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.4;">in Damstadt</span><span style="font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.4;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.4;">on November 4 under the theme "Digital Business Strategies for Enterprise - Ready for Change". Learn from customer case studies, live demo about the Liferay Portal strategy update, expert exchange sessions and through networking with peers, Liferay experts and certified partners how you can implement a digital business strategy for your enterprise.</span></p>
</Summary></root>

Wir laden Sie ein, sich von Anwendervorträgen, einer Live-Demo von Liferay Portal mit Strategie-Update sowie fachspezifischen Expert Exchange Groups sowie Gesprächen mit Fachkollegen, Liferay Experten und Partnern inspirieren zu lassen. Erfahren Sie, wie Sie auf Basis Liferay Portal eine digitale Business Strategie für Ihr Unternehmen umsetzen.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>

Learn from customer case studies, live demo about the Liferay Portal strategy update, expert exchange sessions and through networking with peers, Liferay experts and certified partners how you can implement a digital business strategy for your enterprise.</span></p>
</Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p>
	Treffen Si Liferay Entwickler und IT-Spezialisten zur zweiten Liferay DEVCON in Darmstadt! Sprechen Sie mit Liferay Ingenieuren aus der ganzen Welt und gewinnen Sie wertvolle Erkenntnisse für Ihre Liferay Projekte. Sie erhalten Antworten auf Ihre Fragen, lernen neue Features kennen und haben die Möglichkeit, die Liferay Community und Entwicklung auf einzigartige Weise mitzugestalten. Sie können sich auf viel Zeit zum Wissensaustausch, Netzwerken und Spaß freuen.</p>
<p>
	Auch dieses Jahr bieten wir am 4. November, dem Vortag zur DEVCON, eine UnConference als besonderes Highlight an. Hier gestalten die Teilnehmer die Agenda in der ersten Stunde im Plenum. Die UnConference bietet ein besonderes Umfeld zum Wissensaustausch und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit mit Gleichgesinnten. Die Plätze sind begrenzt und werden nach Verfügbarkeit vergeben.</p>
<p>
	Der Call for Paper ist nun offen und die Eventseite online.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	Join Liferay developers and IT professionals at the second Liferay DEVCON in Darmstadt! Meet Liferay core engineers from around the globe and acquire valuable how-to's applicable to your situation. Get answers to your questions, suggest new features and use the chance to influence Liferay community guidelines and development in a unique way. There will also be plenty of time for knowledge sharing, networking and fun!&nbsp;</p>
<p>
	As an added bonus, we will be hosting an UnConference on November 4th, a day before the actual conference starts. Here, the agenda will be determined in the first session of the day and provide a great environment for knowledge sharing and focused training amongst peers. Seats are limited and based on availability.</p>
<p>
	Call for paper is open and the event site is now online.</p>
</Summary></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	The Liferay Symposium is held in several places such as the US, France and Spain. Now, for the first time, it will take place in Brazil. At this event, we will offer information about business solutions, market trends, and portal technology innovation. We will be featuring important keynotes, interesting cases studies, technical lectures, product demonstrations, and several other activities.</p>
</Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE,it_IT," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p>
	Featuring compelling case studies, keynotes and a product roadmap from experts, Liferay Symposium in Italy is a unique opportunity to make your connection with the Liferay business and tech community. The event features insightful and practical sessions spread over two tracks, a panel discussion time, a partner exhibition area and plenty of time for networking and socializing.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	Featuring compelling case studies, keynotes and a product roadmap from experts, Liferay Symposium in Italy is a unique opportunity to make your connection with the Liferay business and tech community. The event features insightful and practical sessions spread over two tracks, a panel discussion time, a partner exhibition area and plenty of time for networking and socializing. The event site is now available for more information.</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="it_IT"><p>
	Caratterizzato da interessanti casi di studio, keynotes e roadmap di prodotto da parte di esperti, il Liferay Symposium in Italia è un'occasione unica per creare relazioni con la comunità tecnica e business di Liferay. L'evento prevede sessioni approfondite e pratiche, si sviluppa su due percorsi, una volta tavola rotonda, un'area espositiva e spazio per networking e socializzazione.</p>
</Summary></root>

	Join us for our Liferay Symposium in France. The first day will be focused on technical topics, presentations, and discussions, while the second day will be split into business and technical tracks. Come and join us for new learning experiences and networking in Paris. More information on the agenda is coming soon. (The event will be held in English and French.)</p>
</Summary><Summary language-id="fr_FR"><p>
	Le Symposium Liferay France réunit des leaders d'opinion, des pionniers de l'industrie et des ingénieurs clés du monde entier. Rejoignez-nous à Paris pour deuxjournées riche en informations , privilégiant le networking et le partage des connaissances! (Cette conférence se déroulera en français et en anglais.) Plus d'information à suivre.</p>
</Summary></root>

Get answers to your questions, suggest new features and use the chance to influence Liferay community guidelines and development in a unique way. summaryMap.de_DE:
Treffen Sie Liferay-Entwickler und IT-Spezialisten zur dritten Liferay DEVCON in Darmstadt! Sprechen Sie mit Liferay Ingenieuren aus der ganzen Welt und gewinnen Sie wertvolle Erkenntnisse für Ihre Liferay Projekte. Sie erhalten Antworten auf Ihre Fragen, lernen neue Features kennen und haben die Möglichkeit, die Liferay Community und Entwicklung auf einzigartige Weise mitzugestalten. Sie können sich auf viel Zeit zum Wissensaustausch, Netzwerken und Spaß freuen.

Auch dieses Jahr bieten wir am 6.Oktober, dem Vortag zur DEVCON, eine UnConference als besonderes Highlight an. Hier gestalten die Teilnehmer die Agenda in der ersten Stunde im Plenum. Die UnConference bietet ein besonderes Umfeld zum Wissensaustausch und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit mit Gleichgesinnten. Die Plätze sind begrenzt und werden nach Verfügbarkeit vergeben.

Mehr Infos auf unsrer Eventseite.

	Distinguendosi per i suoi interessanti casi di studio, keynotes e roadmap di prodotto, il simposio italiano di Liferay è un'opportunità unica per entrare in contatto con le sue community: business e tecnologica. L'evento include sessioni pratiche e approfondite sviluppate su due sessioni parallele (Business track, Technical track), un'area espositiva per i partner e tanto tempo per socializzare e costruire relazioni. La pagina di registrazione all'evento è ora disponibile, altre informazioni stanno per arrivare. Stay tuned!</p></Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,fr_FR," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><div>
	Liferay Symposium France is the main event of the year. It is a unique occasion that allows attendees to discover the latest updates on our solutions, learn from peers, and contribute to the ever-growing Liferay community.</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	This event is based on the exchange of best practices which permits you to not only discuss with Liferay experts but with our entire community of partners and clients as well.&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	<strong>What to expect:</strong> customer case studies, technical sessions, learn best practices, and networking.</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	Don't miss this exceptional event which will be held at Hôtel Potock, classified as a historical monument and one of the most elegant villas from the XIX century. &nbsp;</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div></Summary><Summary language-id="fr_FR"><div>
	<span style="line-height: 1.4;">Le Symposium est l'événement phare de l'année. Une occasion unique pour découvrir toutes les nouveautés, poser vos questions et contribuer à l'évolution de la communauté et des solutions Liferay. Basée sur le partage, cet événement vous permettra non seulement d'échanger avec les dirigeants mais aussi avec l'écosystème de clients et partenaires Liferay.</span></div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	<strong>Au programme : </strong>retours d'expérience clients, présentations techniques, partage des bonnes pratiques et networking.</div>
<div>
	Ne manquez pas cet événement annuel et incontournable ! Les deux journées se dérouleront à l'Hôtel Potocki. Classé monument historique, il compte parmi les plus élégants hôtels particuliers édifiés au XIXe siècle.&nbsp;</div></Summary></root>

summaryMap.fr_FR:
Le Symposium est l'événement phare de l'année. Une occasion unique pour découvrir toutes les nouveautés, poser vos questions et contribuer à l'évolution de la communauté et des solutions Liferay. Basée sur le partage, cet événement vous permettra non seulement d'échanger avec les dirigeants mais aussi avec l'écosystème de clients et partenaires Liferay.
 
Au programme : retours d'expérience clients, présentations techniques, partage des bonnes pratiques et networking.
Ne manquez pas cet événement annuel et incontournable ! Les deux journées se dérouleront à l'Hôtel Potocki. Classé monument historique, il compte parmi les plus élégants hôtels particuliers édifiés au XIXe siècle.

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p><strong>TOGETHER - wie IT und Marketing die digitale Transformation gemeinsam meistern</strong></p>

<p>Auf dem größten und wichtigsten Liferay Event in der DACH-Region hatten Verantwortliche und Entscheider aus IT, Marketing, Vertrieb und Kommunikation Gelegenheit mehr darüber zu erfahren, wie sie mit Liferay Lösungen die Herausforderungen der digitalen Transformation meistern. Als Weiterentwicklung des früheren Liferay Portal Solutions Forums lag der Fokus des neuen Liferay Digital Solutions Forums (LDSF) auf umfangreichen Networking-Möglichkeiten und einer Vielzahl an Fachvorträgen mit Schwerpunkten vom digitalen Marketing bis hin zu IT Operations digitaler Plattformen.</p>

<p>Sehen Sie sich die Keynotes und Fachvorträge des LDSF jetzt online an unter:&nbsp;<a href="http://www.liferay.com/de/solutionsforum-de">www.liferay.com/solutionsforum-de</a>.</p></Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><p><strong>TOGETHER - wie IT und Marketing die digitale Transformation gemeinsam meistern</strong></p>

<p>Auf dem größten und wichtigsten Liferay Event in der DACH-Region hatten Verantwortliche und Entscheider aus IT, Marketing, Vertrieb und Kommunikation Gelegenheit mehr darüber zu erfahren, wie sie mit Liferay Lösungen die Herausforderungen der digitalen Transformation meistern. Als Weiterentwicklung des früheren Liferay Portal Solutions Forums lag der Fokus des neuen Liferay Digital Solutions Forums (LDSF) auf umfangreichen Networking-Möglichkeiten und einer Vielzahl an Fachvorträgen mit Schwerpunkten vom digitalen Marketing bis hin zu IT Operations digitaler Plattformen.</p>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,es_ES," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	The Liferay Symposium returns to Madrid. Join us at the most important event of the year in Spain to discover the latest news about Liferay, meet the project leaders, and share experiences with many other users, partners and customers. We will present the latest developments in Business Agility, Connected Experiences and Customer Insight to help you attract customers and adapt your business to digital needs.</p>
<p>
	Event registration page is now available! Register now and take advantage of Early-Bird price!</p></Summary><Summary language-id="es_ES"><p>
	El Simposium de Liferay vuelve un año más a Madrid. Únete a nosotros en el evento más importante del año, que te permitirá descubrir las últimas novedades de Liferay, conocer a los líderes del proyecto y compartir experiencias con otros muchos usuarios, partners y clientes de España. Presentaremos las últimas novedades en Business Agility, Experiencias Conectadas y Customer Insight para ayudarte a atraer a tus clientes y adaptar tu negocio al contexto digital donde aquellos se encuentren, garantizándoles una experiencia continua y consistente, a través de los diferentes canales de acceso por los que se conecten. La página de registro del evento ya está disponible.</p>
<p>
	¡Regístrate ahora y aprovecha los precios Early-Bird!</p></Summary></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>
	What does digital engagement really look like? How can you have consistent, meaningful interaction with your customers? Join your peers at the Liferay Digital Solutions Forum to learn about the latest trends in digital business transformation.</p>
<p>
	Discover how others leverage Liferay to reach organisational goals, and get a first-hand look at upcoming features. Engage with certified Liferay partners from the region and network, discuss and connect with your peers.</p></Summary></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,it_IT," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><div>Distinguishing itself for its interesting Case Studies, Keynotes and product roadmap, the Italian Liferay symposium is a unique opportunity to get in touch with its community: business and technology. The event includes practical and in-depth sessions developed in two parallel tracks (Business, Technical), an exhibition area for partners and plenty of time to socialize and build relationships.</div>

<div>&nbsp;</div>

<div>Please visit our recap page <a href="https://web.liferay.com//web/events2016/italy/recap">here</a>.</div></Summary><Summary language-id="it_IT"><div>Distinguendosi per i suoi interessanti casi di studio, keynotes e roadmap di prodotto, il simposio italiano di Liferay è un'opportunità unica per entrare in contatto con le sue community: business e tecnologica. L'evento include sessioni pratiche e approfondite sviluppate su due sessioni parallele (Business track, Technical track), un'area espositiva per i partner e tanto tempo per socializzare e costruire relazioni.</div>

<div>&nbsp;</div>

<div><a href="http://www.liferay.com/italy2016">Andate alla pagina del Recap 2016 &gt;&gt;&gt;</a></div></Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><div>
	Treffen Sie Liferay-Entwickler und IT-Spezialisten zur vierten Liferay DEVCON in Darmstadt! Sprechen Sie mit Liferay Ingenieuren aus der ganzen Welt und gewinnen Sie wertvolle Erkenntnisse für Ihre Liferay Projekte. Sie erhalten Antworten auf Ihre Fragen, lernen neue Features kennen und haben die Möglichkeit, die Liferay Community und Entwicklung auf einzigartige Weise mitzugestalten. Sie können sich auf viel Zeit zum Wissensaustausch, Netzwerken und Spaß freuen.</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	Auch dieses Jahr bieten wir am 14. November, dem Vortag zur DEVCON, eine UnConference als besonderes Highlight an. Hier gestalten die Teilnehmer die Agenda in der ersten Stunde im Plenum. Die UnConference bietet ein besonderes Umfeld zum Wissensaustausch und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit mit Gleichgesinnten. Die Plätze sind begrenzt und werden nach Verfügbarkeit vergeben.</div>
<div>
	&nbsp;</div>
<div>
	Mehr Informationen über unsere Eventseite.</div></Summary><Summary language-id="en_US"><div>Meet Liferay developers and IT professionals to the fourth Liferay DEVCON in Darmstadt! Talk with Liferay engineers from around the world and gain valuable insights for your Liferay projects. Get answers to your questions, learn about new features and use the opportunity to help shape the Liferay community and development in a unique way. You can look forward to a lot of time to exchange knowledge, networking and fun.</div>

<div>&nbsp;</div>

<div>This year we offer on November 14, the day before the DEVCON, a UnConference as a special highlight. Here the participants build the agenda at the beginning in a plenary session. The UnConference offers a special environment for knowledge sharing and targeted exchange with peers. Seats are limited.</div>

<div>&nbsp;</div>

<div>Please visit our recap page: <a href="http://www.liferay.com/devcon">www.liferay.com/devcon</a></div></Summary></root>

Sprechen Sie mit Liferay Ingenieuren aus der ganzen Welt und gewinnen Sie wertvolle Erkenntnisse für Ihre Liferay Projekte. Sie erhalten Antworten auf Ihre Fragen, lernen neue Features kennen und haben die Möglichkeit, die Liferay Community und Entwicklung auf einzigartige Weise mitzugestalten. Sie können sich auf viel Zeit zum Wissensaustausch, Netzwerken und Spaß freuen.
 
Auch dieses Jahr bieten wir am 14. November, dem Vortag zur DEVCON, eine UnConference als besonderes Highlight an. Hier gestalten die Teilnehmer die Agenda in der ersten Stunde im Plenum. Die UnConference bietet ein besonderes Umfeld zum Wissensaustausch und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit mit Gleichgesinnten. Die Plätze sind begrenzt und werden nach Verfügbarkeit vergeben.
 
Mehr Informationen über unsere Eventseite.

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,de_DE," default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="de_DE"><p>Verantwortliche und Entscheider aus IT und Business hatten&nbsp;auf dem Liferay Digital Solutions Forum (LDSF) in Wien die Möglichkeit mehr darüber zu erfahren, wie die neue Liferay Digital Experience Platform (DXP) die digitale Transformation ihres Unternehmens unterstützt. Das aktive Forum bot verschiedene Networking-Formate für einen optimalen Austausch an einem Ort. Das aktive Forum bot verschiedene Networking-Formate für einen optimalen Austausch an einem Ort. Auch die langjährigen Projekt-Erfahrungen der Liferay Service Partner wurden noch stärker integriert.

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="fr_FR" default-locale="fr_FR"><Summary language-id="fr_FR">Tout le monde parle de <strong>transformation digitale</strong>, mais quelles sont les bonnes pratiques de ceux qui l'ont réellement conduite dans le secteur de l'industrie ?<br />

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p><strong>Building Cutting Edge Customer Experience and Omnichannel Solutions in the Middle East</strong></p>

<p>Having a local business manager in Dubai, who can respond to the needs and requests of customers, Liferay aims to equip IT teams and and their business counterparts at the intersection of technology, marketing and customer experience to work together for effective digital transformation to take place. This event will be part of a three day roadshow in Riyadh, Dubai and Abu Dhabi launching the Liferay office in the Middle East!</p></Summary></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Summary language-id="en_US"><p><strong>Le RDV incontournable de la communauté Liferay</strong></p>

<p>Tout le monde parle d’expérience client mais quelles sont les bonnes pratiques de ceux qui ont réellement replacé le client au centre de leur activité ?</p>

<p>Repenser les parcours clients, casser les silos organisationnels et créer des expériences digitales cohérentes sur l’ensemble des canaux sont autant<br />
d’impératifs pour les entreprises et de sujets qui seront abordés lors de cette 7ème édition.</p>

<p><strong>Ne manquez pas les retours d’expérience de : Airbus, Danone, CNAF, Msheireb et TOTAL.</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">26 avril : Rencontre Technique</span></li>
	<li style="-webkit-text-size-adjust:100%; -ms-text-size-adjust:100%"><span style="color: #000000;">27 avril : Symposium </span></li>
</ul>

<hr /></Summary></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Huage a rejoint Liferay France en 2013 en tant que consultant technique pour supporter les clients et les partenaires français de Liferay, notamment sur l'architecture, l'implémentation et le développement avec Liferay Portal. Huage a travaillé précédemment chez FatWire et Oracle sur les produits de Web Content Management et Web Experience Management pendant 4 ans. Huage possède un diplôme d'ingénieur en informatique de l'INSA de Lyon.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Huage a rejoint Liferay France en 2013 en tant que consultant technique pour supporter les clients et les partenaires français de Liferay, notamment sur l'architecture, l'implémentation et le développement avec Liferay Portal. Huage a travaillé précédemment chez FatWire et Oracle sur les produits de Web Content Management et Web Experience Management pendant 4 ans. Huage possède un diplôme d'ingénieur en informatique de l'INSA de Lyon.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Liferay has a powerful API, but the size of it can be overwhealming. Follow Olaf on a tour into the API - see what's necessary to remote-control Liferay and use the features you can easily unlock with a little bit of code</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Liferay has a powerful API, but the size of it can be overwhealming. Follow Olaf on a tour into the API - see what's necessary to remote-control Liferay and use the features you can easily unlock with a little bit of code

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Olaf a tout d’abord été un membre actif de la communauté Liferay, en 2008. Il a ensuite rejoint Liferay Allemagne en tant que conseiller technique et formateur en 2010 et gère actuellement le programme de formation en Europe. Il répond à de nombreuses questions concernant les caractéristiques des solutions Liferay, l'architecture et les meilleures pratiques lors de formations et conférences. En charge du podcast "Radio Liferay", il met en valeur le côté personnel des professionnels impliqués dans l’aventure Liferay et annonce les nouvelles fonctionnalités et activités à venir.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Olaf a tout d’abord été un membre actif de la communauté Liferay, en 2008. Il a ensuite rejoint Liferay Allemagne en tant que conseiller technique et formateur en 2010 et gère actuellement le programme de formation en Europe. Il répond à de nombreuses questions concernant les caractéristiques des solutions Liferay, l'architecture et les meilleures pratiques lors de formations et conférences. En charge du podcast "Radio Liferay", il met en valeur le côté personnel des professionnels impliqués dans l’aventure Liferay et annonce les nouvelles fonctionnalités et activités à venir.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Cette session a pour but de présenter les points essentiels des changements apportés dans Liferay. Les nouveaux concepts et les bonnes pratiques seront illustrés, notamment le développement, le déploiement, la customisation et la migration. 

Ceci permettra de faciliter la prise en main de Liferay DXP pour les développeurs déjà familiers avec les versions précédentes de Liferay.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Cette session a pour but de présenter les points essentiels des changements apportés dans Liferay. Les nouveaux concepts et les bonnes pratiques seront illustrés, notamment le développement, le déploiement, la customisation et la migration. 

Ceci permettra de faciliter la prise en main de Liferay DXP pour les développeurs déjà familiers avec les versions précédentes de Liferay.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Huage a rejoint Liferay France en 2013 en tant que consultant technique pour supporter les clients et les partenaires français de Liferay, notamment sur l'architecture, l'implémentation et le développement avec Liferay Portal. Huage a travaillé précédemment chez FatWire et Oracle sur les produits de Web Content Management et Web Experience Management pendant 4 ans. Huage possède un diplôme d'ingénieur en informatique de l'INSA de Lyon.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">NoSQL, Serverless, DevOps, Social Auth, ... Developers these days want to forget about infrastructure and simply build great scalable apps quickly. This just got easier and I'll prove it to you by live coding an application that you can interact with during the talk (bring your laptop and/or smartphone).

While having fun playing with what I code, you'll learn how to easily build any web application - from simple SPAs trough a full micro-service architecture to complex enterprise applications.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Milen est consultant senior chez Liferay aidant certaines des plus grandes entreprises européennes à adopter et/ ou à migrer vers le portail Liferay. Avant de rejoindre Liferay en 2012, il a passé plus de 10 ans à la conception et au développement des solutions Java EE pour les principales sociétés européennes couvrant les domaines suivants : portail d'entreprise, e-commerce, intégration d'applications d'entreprise, applications Web pour les appareils mobiles et adaptation du contenu.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Modularity promises to reduce efforts spent on customizing and extending existing systems. Often, the trend of REST-based microservices, however, only shifts complexity from development to operations. This presentation is supposed to offer insight into Liferay's view of in-process microservices and how they can help minimize run time complexity.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Modularity promises to reduce efforts spent on customizing and extending existing systems. Often, the trend of REST-based microservices, however, only shifts complexity from development to operations. This presentation is supposed to offer insight into Liferay's view of in-process microservices and how they can help minimize run time complexity.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Le javascript, autrefois tant décrié par les développeurs, est devenu avec les frameworks modernes le paradis du codeur ! Y a t-il un moyen d'en tirer partie pour simplifier le développement des portlets ? Ce court talk se focalisera sur Ember.js et sur l'environnement Ember CLI pour monter comment tirer la quintessence des possibilités de cet outil en couplage avec le déploiement portlet et la création de services vie le Service Builder de Liferay.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Consultant indépendant, Sébastien opère sur des projets Liferay depuis bientôt 10 ans (dont plus de 6 au sein d’une société de services partenaire Gold de Liferay pendant cette période). sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">La qualité et la maintenabilité des applications produites passent par des phases de tests et de recette, tâches qui sont souvent coûteuses et chronophages et dans lesquelles certains cas d'utilisation sont difficiles à tester.
 </br>
Pour identifier très rapidement des bugs applicatifs dans le but de garantir un niveau de qualité optimale dans nos livrables, nous avons mis en place une stratégie de tests sur l'un de nos projets : tests unitaires, tests d'intégration et test fonctionnels automatisés.
 </b>
Notre présentation vous détaillera les différents moyens et outils mis en place pour tester notre portail Liferay.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
La qualité et la maintenabilité des applications produites passent par des phases de tests et de recette, tâches qui sont souvent coûteuses et chronophages et dans lesquelles certains cas d'utilisation sont difficiles à tester.
Pour identifier très rapidement des bugs applicatifs dans le but de garantir un niveau de qualité optimale dans nos livrables, nous avons mis en place une stratégie de tests sur l'un de nos projets : tests unitaires, tests d'intégration et test fonctionnels automatisés. Notre présentation vous détaillera les différents moyens et outils mis en place pour tester notre portail Liferay.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Fort d’une première expérience sur Liferay durant 7 années en tant que concepteur développeur et expert, Anthony est aujourd’hui architecte senior au sein d’un skill center spécialisé Liferay chez Orange Business Services. A ce titre, Anthony intervient sur des prestations de conseil, audit et expertise pour différents clients mais également en tant que référent technique (technical leader) sur bon nombre de projets au forfait ou encore auprès des équipes.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Acteur européen de référence des services informatiques à valeur ajoutée et des logiciels, Gfi Informatique occupe un positionnement stratégique différenciant entre les opérateurs de taille mondiale et les acteurs de niche.</br> 
</br>
Avec son profil de multi-spécialiste, le Groupe met au service de ses clients une combinaison unique de proximité, d’organisation sectorielle et de solutions de qualité industrielle. Le Groupe qui compte près de 14 000 collaborateurs a réalisé en 2016 un chiffre d’affaires de 1 015 M€.</br>
</br>
</br>
Plus d’informations sur www.gfi.world</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Bryan Cheung et l'un des fondateurs de l'entreprise depuis sa création en 2004 et dirige l'orientation stratégique de la société dans le monde entier et le développement commercial. S'appuyant sur son expérience technique, la compréhension des besoins des clients, et une passion pour les utilisateurs finaux, Bryan définit les orientations stratégiques de Liferay afin de respecter son engagement à fournir des solutions Business ciblées et efficaces à ses clients et sa communauté. Bryan est diplômé de l'Université de Californie, Berkeley, avec un diplôme en informatique. Bryan est un conférencier recherché dans les grands événements IT et de l'industrie Open Source.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nous vivons actuellement une époque de Renaissance. La science et la technologie font des progrès immenses, qui mettent l'ordre ancien bien souvent en porte à faux. Avec le numérique, les clients sont en réseaux et créent une forme d'intelligence collective. Les frontières de l'entreprise étant poreuses, les collaborateurs aussi se mettent en réseau. Les modèles traditionnels hiérarchiques, basés sur la méfiance, sont bousculés par cette révolution. L'information en réseau a pris la main. L'innovation est aujourd'hui ouverte, en codesign, et partagée. L'entreprise doit viser l'homéostasie.</br>
</br> 
Que ce soient les salariés face à leurs managers, les clients face aux marques, les citoyens face aux politiques, nous trouvons le même triptyque : fun, engagement, collaboration. 
La relation à l'ordre ancien est bouleversée. Les citoyens ne sont plus des assujettis captifs et sont en train de créer la démocratie participative. De même dans l'entreprise, les salariés ne veulent plus « un contrat de subordination », mais veulent participer activement à la vie de l'entreprise.</br>
</br> 
Au-delà du « pourquoi » seront abordés le « quoi », et le « comment » passer l'entreprise à un mode réseau, pleine de sens.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nicolas FANJEAU is leading the IT Tools “Start-up” for Airbus, the global aircraft manufacturer. He has been working in IT domain for more than 15 years. His work covered different areas, from infrastructure to development. Before joining Airbus, Nicolas worked for IT companies like CapGemini, where he was responsible for monitoring, backup and tooling for world-class companies. Later, he joined Airbus Defence & Space as a Technical leader for Ground Segment of the key European program. Recently, he has been appointed responsible of the IT Tools “Start-up” for Airbus and is in charge for tools delivery to support the Airbus Infrastructure department and promote the usage of Open Source. Early 2016 he received the Award “IT Digital transformation project of the year” (from Solutions-Numériques) for the deployment of an ITSM solution based on Open Source Software. To encourage a new way of working, the start-up concept is based on small team in charge of delivering a well-defined and ambitious target with minimal boundaries.</Description></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Orange orchestre le plus important projet de ville intelligente des pays du Golfe à Doha. Il intervient sur la fourniture de la majorité des applications et services intelligents du quartier historique « Msheireb Downtown Doha », projet phare de ville intelligente ou « Smart City» du Qatar et de sa région.</br>
</br>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Suite au constat sur l ’ « offre partenaires » de l’hétérogénéité des technologies et infrastructures utilisées, d’interfaces disparates, de l’absence de dimension collaborative, la CNAF a choisi LIFERAY pour la mise en place d’une offre de portail partenaire multi canal bénéficiant en outre de la capacité « Fabrique à portails » pour les extranets partenaire existants. 
<br>
Les enjeux pour la CNAF sont : 
<br>
•	la transformation métier du portail « mon compte partenaire » (notion d’espace partenaire, charte graphique et ergonomique commune à tous les services, parcours du partenaire sur le portail, services transverses pour les habilitations, traces, métriques…). 
<br>
•	La transformation technique du portail « mon compte partenaire » (pour chaque service, la réalisation technique a fait l’objet d’une transformation par rapport au service précédent).
<br>
•	Transformation de la gouvernance (introduction de concepts AGILE dans la réalisation, i.e. print , backlog, poker planning, rétrospective, démo, scrum board…).</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Suite au constat sur l ’ « offre partenaires » de l’hétérogénéité des technologies et infrastructures utilisées, d’interfaces disparates, de l’absence de dimension collaborative, la CNAF a choisi LIFERAY pour la mise en place d’une offre de portail partenaire multi canal bénéficiant en outre de la capacité « Fabrique à portails » pour les extranets partenaire existants.
Les enjeux pour la CNAF sont :
• la transformation métier du portail « mon compte partenaire » (notion d’espace partenaire, charte graphique et ergonomique commune à tous les services, parcours du partenaire sur le portail, services transverses pour les habilitations, traces, métriques…).
• La transformation technique du portail « mon compte partenaire » (pour chaque service, la réalisation technique a fait l’objet d’une transformation par rapport au service précédent).
• Transformation de la gouvernance (introduction de concepts AGILE dans la réalisation, i.e. print , backlog, poker planning, rétrospective, démo, scrum board…).

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Christophe intervient depuis près de 20 ans dans le domaine IT, avec des champs d’expertise technologique liés au monde du web, des tests de performance, des processus de transformation et de migration d’applications.
</br>
 </br>

Après avoir contribué à la mise en œuvre d’un important site de vente en ligne, dont il a rapidement pris le pilotage, Christophe a souhaité se spécialiser dans la gestion de projet, fort de ses diverses missions en sociétés de service, ponctuées d’une certification PMP ® obtenue en 2012.

 </br>
</br>
En 2013, Christophe a rejoint la branche Famille de la Sécurité Sociale au sein de la CNAF, où il apporte son expertise en matière de pilotage de grands projets et de programmes. Il est aujourd’hui fortement impliqué sur la mise en œuvre du nouveau portail partenaires, permettant de concentrer les différents services métier offerts aux partenaires de la CNAF.
</br></Description></root>

summary:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale=""><Summary language-id="en_US"><p>Meet Liferay developers and IT professionals to the fifth Liferay DEVCON in Amsterdam! Talk with Liferay engineers from around the world and gain valuable insights for your Liferay projects. Get answers to your questions, learn about new features and use the opportunity to help shape the Liferay community and development in a unique way. You can look forward to a lot of time to exchange knowledge, networking and fun.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
This year we offer on October 4, the day before the DEVCON, a UnConference as a special highlight. Here the participants build the agenda at the beginning in a plenary session. The UnConference offers a special environment for knowledge sharing and targeted exchange with peers.</p>

<p>Seats for DEVCON and Unconference are limited. Don't miss to register soon at <a href="http://www.liferay.com/devcon" target="_blank">www.liferay.com/devcon</a></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p></Summary></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jorge will shed light on major developments going on at Liferay and being unveiled at DEVCON. He will present our innovative new approach to empower and coordinate front-end developers, designers and marketers to create and maintain pixel-perfect modern websites; Some very exciting news about APIs; Advances towards deeply personal analytics and share progress in WeDeploy and best practice for DXP cloud deployments. The session will also include a special message from Chief Software Architect Brian Chan.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Jorge will shed light on major developments going on at Liferay and being unveiled at DEVCON. He will present our innovative new approach to empower and coordinate front-end developers, designers and marketers to create and maintain pixel-perfect modern websites; Some very exciting news about APIs; Advances towards deeply personal analytics and share progress in WeDeploy and best practice for DXP cloud deployments. The session will also include a special message from Chief Software Architect Brian Chan.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jorge is VP of Engineering at Liferay. He has a passion in bringing technology closer to users as a way to solve real world problems and add value to our society. He also believes that Open Source is a key driver to achieving it, since it's not only the most efficient way to build software but also most ethical way to deliver it.</Description></root>

assetCategoriesJSONArray.name: New Features

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Content is viewed on all sorts of devices these days, which all have different screen sizes, bandwidths, processing capabilities, etc. Adaptive Media is a new application for Liferay DXP that delivers your media content in the best format, based on the channel and device that will consume it. This provides faster loading times, saves bandwidth and gives you administrative control over the image quality. Learn how this new tool integrates with other Liferay applications and how to use it with any device via a powerful and simple API.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Content is viewed on all sorts of devices these days, which all have different screen sizes, bandwidths, processing capabilities, etc. Adaptive Media is a new application for Liferay DXP that delivers your media content in the best format, based on the channel and device that will consume it. This provides faster loading times, saves bandwidth and gives you administrative control over the image quality. Learn how this new tool integrates with other Liferay applications and how to use it with any device via a powerful and simple API.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Sergio González joined Liferay in 2010 and he works as Sr. Software Engineer, leading the efforts of the Document Management System and the Collaboration Suite in Liferay. Prior to Liferay, Sergio worked for KPMG as an IT Advisory specialist auditing financial systems. Sergio holds a Telecommunications Engineering degree with a master's degree in Computer Science by Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Spain.</Description></root>

assetCategoriesJSONArray.title: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Title language-id="en_US">Track C</Title></root>
assetCategoriesJSONArray.name: Track C

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Upgrades are hard; let's not mince words. However, upgrades don't have to be so unpredictable and risky. When moving to Liferay DXP, people have many questions about the upgrade experience: how much work is involved, how much of what I know now do I have to throw away, how many new technologies do I have to learn? The questions that mount seem daunting. Therefore, we want you to come to this presentation to learn about some tools built specifically with the purpose of answering these questions. If you want to upgrade to DXP from Liferay 6.1 or 6.2, we will demonstrate how using these tools can help you estimate the amount of code that needs to be changed, which extension points have been deprecated or removed, how to migrate to new APIs and how to either continue to use existing frameworks you have already been using or leverage new modularity features in DXP. Let us help you breathe a little easier and not get your heart rate up so high the next time you consider upgrading to DXP.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Upgrades are hard; let's not mince words. However, upgrades don't have to be so unpredictable and risky. When moving to Liferay DXP, people have many questions about the upgrade experience: how much work is involved, how much of what I know now do I have to throw away, how many new technologies do I have to learn? The questions that mount seem daunting. Therefore, we want you to come to this presentation to learn about some tools built specifically with the purpose of answering these questions. If you want to upgrade to DXP from Liferay 6.1 or 6.2, we will demonstrate how using these tools can help you estimate the amount of code that needs to be changed, which extension points have been deprecated or removed, how to migrate to new APIs and how to either continue to use existing frameworks you have already been using or leverage new modularity features in DXP. Let us help you breathe a little easier and not get your heart rate up so high the next time you consider upgrading to DXP.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Greg leads the IDE-based developer tooling support for Liferay Portal and created Liferay IDE to offer officially supported developer tooling for Eclipse. Prior to Liferay, Greg was a Senior Developer for the MyEclipse Enterprise Workbench and the Lead Developer for the MyEclipse Blue Edition. Greg holds a M.S. in Computer Systems Engineering from the University of Arkansas, US.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Greg leads the IDE-based developer tooling support for Liferay Portal and created Liferay IDE to offer officially supported developer tooling for Eclipse. sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">How many hours does you and your team spend configuring Liferay DXP or Liferay Portal? What do you do when there are thousands of people accessing your application at the same time? How do you scale it properly? How much money does your company spend with all this DevOps work? In this talk, you'll see how WeDeploy can speed up development of Liferay projects, minimize costs of infrastructure, and help you build the next generation of applications.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: How many hours does you and your team spend configuring Liferay DXP or Liferay Portal? What do you do when there are thousands of people accessing your application at the same time? How do you scale it properly? How much money does your company spend with all this DevOps work? In this talk, you'll see how WeDeploy can speed up development of Liferay projects, minimize costs of infrastructure, and help you build the next generation of applications.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Learn why we developed Metal.js and how it makes it easier for you to create custom UI components. We will analyze its current state and explore when it is the right tool for your project and when you might want to use it to extend Liferay's UI. Finally, hear our future plans for Metal.js and the direction the framework is taking in the future.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Learn why we developed Metal.js and how it makes it easier for you to create custom UI components. We will analyze its current state and explore when it is the right tool for your project and when you might want to use it to extend Liferay's UI. Finally, hear our future plans for Metal.js and the direction the framework is taking in the future.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Since joining the company in 2004, Brett has been the Lead Consultant on a variety of projects including the World Food Programme, Cisco Systems, and the Online Computer Library Center (OCLC). Brett specializes in end-to-end development, commonly leading the entire product lifecycle from the initial architecture and design, to the final release and subsequent support. His current experiences with Liferay integration involve working with Tomcat, Websphere, Oracle, MySQL, DB2, SAP, Stellent Integration, Siebel, and many others. Brett holds a B.S. in Computer Science from the California State University, Fullerton.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel joined Liferay three years ago and soon after launched the Liferay Screens effort internally, to give developers the right tools for developong enterprise mobile apps. During these years he and his team have released 5 major versions and several betas of Liferay Screens, both for iOS and Android. Prior to joining Liferay, he used to be the CTO or Chief Architect in several startups both in Europe and America. In his spare time, he teaches at the university, participates in local non-profits or takes care of his two lovely kids.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Liferay DXP is built using a philosophy of "secure by design," but this doesn't mean all the work is done for you. The attack surface for a Liferay implementation certainly involves the platform itself but can be unintentionally and sometimes significantly increased by external integration points and custom development. This session will provide an overview of the tools and techniques you can use to secure your platform implementation and discuss how to best prevent and detect any intrusions into your mission critical applications.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Liferay DXP is built using a philosophy of "secure by design," but this doesn't mean all the work is done for you. The attack surface for a Liferay implementation certainly involves the platform itself but can be unintentionally and sometimes significantly increased by external integration points and custom development. This session will provide an overview of the tools and techniques you can use to secure your platform implementation and discuss how to best prevent and detect any intrusions into your mission critical applications.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nathan Shaw is a Principal Consultant with Liferay, Inc. and joined Liferay in 2010 after developing enterprise applications based on the Liferay platform for many years. He has a background in physics but has been applying his analytical skills as a software engineer and architect for over a decade. He is based in the fine state of Ohio and enjoys working directly with key clients and partners in his role with Liferay Consulting. Nathan holds a B.S. in Physics from Hope College and a Ph.D. in Experimental Nuclear Physics from Stony Brook University.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">OSGi is an evolving set of modularity specifications for Java. Release 7 will be available soon, providing a host of interesting additions and updates. From new specifications like JAX-RS, Converter, Push Streams and updates like constructor injection for Declarative Services, release 7 is sure to contain something of value for every developer.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: OSGi is an evolving set of modularity specifications for Java. Release 7 will be available soon, providing a host of interesting additions and updates. From new specifications like JAX-RS, Converter, Push Streams and updates like constructor injection for Declarative Services, release 7 is sure to contain something of value for every developer.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ray Augé is a Senior Software Architect focused on feature development and innovation. Since joining Liferay in 2005, his goal has been to increase ease of development without compromising creativity. Recently, he has prototyped and placed into production, a remote publishing, workflow-driven staging implementation complete with in-context preview, page versioning, website branching and rapid data modeling for application development. He has driven numerous improvements in areas such as permissioning, dynamic data models and metadata support, WCM, and Import/Export. He leads the charge for upcoming implementations of wRAD in Liferay. Raymond holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Laurentian University.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In the world of web development, things are always changing. The first portlet specification came out in October 2003 and, as one would expect, things have changed since then. With that in mind, we are proposing a new way of developing portlets that we think will add a lot of value for those wanting faster development speed, improved user experience with lightning fast navigations and state of the art technology like ES6 and Hybrid Rendering (isomorphic rendering). Come join us to see how SoyPortlet, Senna.js and Metal.js come together to provide a better experience for both developers and users.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: In the world of web development, things are always changing. The first portlet specification came out in October 2003 and, as one would expect, things have changed since then. With that in mind, we are proposing a new way of developing portlets that we think will add a lot of value for those wanting faster development speed, improved user experience with lightning fast navigations and state of the art technology like ES6 and Hybrid Rendering (isomorphic rendering). Come join us to see how SoyPortlet, Senna.js and Metal.js come together to provide a better experience for both developers and users.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">There are many perspectives on what a Single Customer View is (and isn’t), and one of the most common misconceptions is that an SCV is either a piece of software or an off-the-shelf product. The Single Customer View is not only a product but is in fact a process that your data must follow to make it ready and suitable for marketing, analytics and insight. It is a state of mind. Through the extraction, transformation and load process, the SCV should take all the data you hold about your customers on an automated journey of matching, cleansing and enhancement.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: There are many perspectives on what a Single Customer View is (and isn’t), and one of the most common misconceptions is that an SCV is either a piece of software or an off-the-shelf product. The Single Customer View is not only a product but is in fact a process that your data must follow to make it ready and suitable for marketing, analytics and insight. It is a state of mind. Through the extraction, transformation and load process, the SCV should take all the data you hold about your customers on an automated journey of matching, cleansing and enhancement.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Any successful Liferay DXP upgrade project requires preparation. Many questions need answers before you can start. What do I gain from an upgrade? What do I need to plan for in an upgrade? How do I figure out the risks in an upgrade project? How do I mitigate these risks? Each of these questions inevitably leads to more questions. Help ensure the success of your project by learning how to answer these questions for your project.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Any successful Liferay DXP upgrade project requires preparation. Many questions need answers before you can start. What do I gain from an upgrade? What do I need to plan for in an upgrade? How do I figure out the risks in an upgrade project? How do I mitigate these risks? Each of these questions inevitably leads to more questions. Help ensure the success of your project by learning how to answer these questions for your project.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">With the explosion of content, it’s no longer sufficient to wait for users to search for information and receive “dumb” updates. Discover how Liferay DXP is solving the problem of getting the right information to the right people using search engine technologies. In this session, we will discuss how search technologies form the foundation of many machine learning algorithms. We will also show upcoming Liferay features that will greatly improve how your users will leverage search within the platform.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Machine learning (ML) is a trendy word that everyone wants to use in their systems, but that most people don't even know what to do with. We will show real Machine Learning applications working in Liferay for real use case scenarios. The best part is that it will be dead easy to understand. DXP is an extensible and customizable platform, that can virtually integrate with anything. Leverage on ML and get the most out of your data to let Liferay carry out what otherwise would be extremely complex tasks.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Structures and templates as well as an AssetPublisher with ADTs are among the most powerful features of Liferay. But frequent questions in forums show, that people have troubles with them. This talk aims to show our experiences, best practices, tips and tricks for their use, with some refinements for Liferay 7. Some topics include: <br>
- Use source code control with structures/templates <br>
- Use multiple webcontent templates for the same structure <br>
- Render content with a specific template <br>
- Enable and use serviceLocator and other useful utilities <br>
- Transport structures/templates from test to production <br></Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Structures and templates as well as an AssetPublisher with ADTs are among the most powerful features of Liferay. But frequent questions in forums show, that people have troubles with them. This talk aims to show our experiences, best practices, tips and tricks for their use, with some refinements for Liferay 7. Some topics include:
- Use source code control with structures/templates
- Use multiple webcontent templates for the same structure
- Render content with a specific template
- Enable and use serviceLocator and other useful utilities
- Transport structures/templates from test to production

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Writing a great web API isn't easy. It must be efficient, consistent, easy to use, RESTful, and it has to be ready ASAP. And when it succeeds and you think you're done, evolving it can be an even greater challenge. Vulcan makes all this easier. It facilitates the creation of Web APIs and consumers that are designed to evolve over time as much as desired – without versioning or other hassles – while preserving the characteristics of great web APIs.

Whether you are developing the APIs or the mobile apps or microservices that consume them, prepare to be amazed by the possibilities of using Hypermedia and standard vocabularies in APIs.

Whether you are developing the APIs or the mobile apps or microservices that consume them, prepare to be amazed by the possibilities of using Hypermedia and standard vocabularies in APIs.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">How to provide an amazing and personalized forms experience in a very effortless way? Liferay now offers a manner to solve this challenge: applying rules to forms and making them behave according to your users' responses. The Rules API is a very useful tool to leverage the power of Forms into your own app. We give you some rules out of the box, like show and hide, autofill, jumping pages and the best thing is: they are adaptable to your needs. This talk will cover the Form Rules API in depth, giving insights of how to use them to truly connect to your crowd.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">There are many reasons to use Liferay for complex business applications. Its many features like assets, full-text search and documents give you a head start implementing complex functionality in a short time and gives you more time to focus on business topics. However, business applications pose their own intricate challenges, because a major architectural requirement in such applications is that business data is kept separate from Liferay. This is a complex technical undertaking, because data must not be kept within Liferay’s assets. 

In this talk we will show you how USU implemented an individual solution that is fully integrated through Liferay’s asset framework while still keeping business data completely isolated. This includes creating and updating assets based on business data, displaying data in context, adding faceted data to the search index and relating and linking assets. We will share both concepts and implementation details, like source code excerpts.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
There are many reasons to use Liferay for complex business applications. Its many features like assets, full-text search and documents give you a head start implementing complex functionality in a short time and gives you more time to focus on business topics. However, business applications pose their own intricate challenges, because a major architectural requirement in such applications is that business data is kept separate from Liferay. This is a complex technical undertaking, because data must not be kept within Liferay’s assets. 

In this talk we will show you how USU implemented an individual solution that is fully integrated through Liferay’s asset framework while still keeping business data completely isolated. This includes creating and updating assets based on business data, displaying data in context, adding faceted data to the search index and relating and linking assets. We will share both concepts and implementation details, like source code excerpts.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Andreas Firnau is Chief Consultant, team lead and project manager at USU AG and has been with the company since 2008. Andreas has worked with many of USU&#39;s Liferay clients. His work includes Liferay consulting, architecture, business process analysis and project management . Andreas also has experience around the overall design, development, and implementation of Internet, Intranet, and Extranet solutions. Having worked with every major release of Liferay since v4.3, he comes with a deep knowledge of the Liferay Portal product. Andreas joined USU with over 5 years of software project management experience in the telecom industry. Andreas holds a degree as Diplom-Ingenieur (FH) from the Hochschule Esslingen, University of Applied Sciences and is a certified IPMA level C project manager.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Through regulation like GDPR, the intend is to strengthen and unify data protection for all individuals in the EU. While the intention is great, it remains to be seen how it is going to work for people with disabilities. In Europe, more than 25 million people have dyslexia to the extent that they can't reliably use a 4-digit PIN unless they can choose their own number. People with intellectual impairment may have a problem keeping the number secret, so a biometric identification method would be more suitable for them. Insurance companies and healthcare organizations need to reinvent themselves to stay ahead of the curve, stay current with compliancy laws and regulations and redefine the way they do business. Digital transformation means getting all of your customers online, knowing who the customer is and engaging with them in a meaningful way. 

In this session Mathijs will explain how Philadelphia, a healthcare organization for people with mental disabilities, has developed a working solution to the challenges. Mathijs will show how Componence and Onegini added verification through biometrics for all of their customers. Some of the trends in the changing market in biometrics will be shown. See a live demo of the use case of Philadelphia where fingerprint and face recognition is used for people with disabilities.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:

While the intention is great, it remains to be seen how it is going to work for people with disabilities. In Europe, more than 25 million people have dyslexia to the extent that they can't reliably use a 4-digit PIN unless they can choose their own number. People with intellectual impairment may have a problem keeping the number secret, so a biometric identification method would be more suitable for them. Insurance companies and healthcare organizations need to reinvent themselves to stay ahead of the curve, stay current with compliancy laws and regulations and redefine the way they do business. Digital transformation means getting all of your customers online, knowing who the customer is and engaging with them in a meaningful way. 

In this session Mathijs will explain how Philadelphia, a healthcare organization for people with mental disabilities, has developed a working solution to the challenges. Mathijs will show how Componence and Onegini added verification through biometrics for all of their customers. Some of the trends in the changing market in biometrics will be shown. sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Over the last few years we've seen an increase in the importance of APIs in connecting systems internally and also in providing services to 3rd party developers, creating what is known as the API economy. This approach provides many benefits, but also interesting challenges. In this session we will present some key improvements we are making to the Liferay platform to help solve these challenges. We will introduce a new breed of Web APIs that we are developing with a focus on security and evolvability. The goal is not only to make it possible to access the functionality on the platform from Mobile Apps, Microservices or IoT devices, but to design them in such a way that new features can be introduced over time without breaking this external system. We will even review some tricks to make them able to learn new features without any code changes.</Description></root>

We will introduce a new breed of Web APIs that we are developing with a focus on security and evolvability. The goal is not only to make it possible to access the functionality on the platform from Mobile Apps, Microservices or IoT devices, but to design them in such a way that new features can be introduced over time without breaking this external system. We will even review some tricks to make them able to learn new features without any code changes.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nowadays Javascript is becoming more and more popular language, its capabilities allow faster delivery of rich frontend applications than in standard server side Java frontend.
 We plan to present how to combine React JS with Liferay portal to get best from both platforms. We would like to point out: Liferay portal &#8211; robustness of CMS and configuration possibilities, Javascript &#8211; rapid development practices. We will present limitations and pitfalls we face during our devstack development. We would like to also finish our presentation with demo of an application built on our stack.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Nowadays Javascript is becoming more and more popular language, its capabilities allow faster delivery of rich frontend applications than in standard server side Java frontend.
 We plan to present how to combine React JS with Liferay portal to get best from both platforms. We would like to point out: Liferay portal – robustness of CMS and configuration possibilities, Javascript – rapid development practices. We will present limitations and pitfalls we face during our devstack development. We would like to also finish our presentation with demo of an application built on our stack.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">I’m with Liferay from version 5, during these years I have been working on several project including telco operators (O2 SK/CZ, T-Mobile), banks (RB, Moneta, ČMSS), ČTÚ and other institutions in Czech Republic. I have started my career as developer and went through team leader and architect to consultant role. I have also been doing audits of proper Liferay deployment. Currently I am involved in development of our Rect union dev stack (Liferay + React).</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Large projects inevitably involve some sort of data migration. While the data may be different, the general migration can often be reduced to the same problems, and therefore solved efficiently with the same best practices. Learn insights gained from Liferay's years of experience, plus see a tool we developed that facilitates fast, efficient and scalable data migrations.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Large projects inevitably involve some sort of data migration. While the data may be different, the general migration can often be reduced to the same problems, and therefore solved efficiently with the same best practices. Learn insights gained from Liferay's years of experience, plus see a tool we developed that facilitates fast, efficient and scalable data migrations.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Igor Arouca joined Liferay just after earning a master’s degree in Business Administration from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2013. He also holds a B.S. in Computer Engineering from the University of Sao Paulo, Brazil, and brings more than 12 years of experience designing and implementing enterprise-level applications. At Liferay, Igor works as a Sr. Principal Consultant helping clients from various industries design, develop, integrate, and optimize their software applications. Many of those clients have been actively moving to Liferay’s new OSGi-based platform, and Igor is helping them architect scalable modular applications.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In the 21st century the IoT is actually happening. Even in the world of retail stores colours are used to create engaging experiences and persuade customers towards a sale. Philips Hue is the next step in smart and efficient lighting. Together with the Audience Targeting functionality of Liferay, you can truly integrate into the world of the customer. 
 At ACA we have developed an example case where Audience Targeting meets Philips Hue to empower the sales of a travel agency.
 This presentation explores the possibility of integrating Audience Targeting with Philips Hue lightning. Spectators will leave the presentation with a sweet notion on how to perform the integrations themselves, learning from code examples and a live demo.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
In the 21st century the IoT is actually happening. Even in the world of retail stores colours are used to create engaging experiences and persuade customers towards a sale. Philips Hue is the next step in smart and efficient lighting. Together with the Audience Targeting functionality of Liferay, you can truly integrate into the world of the customer. 
 At ACA we have developed an example case where Audience Targeting meets Philips Hue to empower the sales of a travel agency.
 This presentation explores the possibility of integrating Audience Targeting with Philips Hue lightning. Spectators will leave the presentation with a sweet notion on how to perform the integrations themselves, learning from code examples and a live demo.
