sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Continuous Delivery is the ability to get changes into the hands of users, safely and quickly in a sustainable way. This session will walk you through the benefits of automating software deployment into production. It will introduce the principles and practices that enable Continuous Delivery, and will describe how they are being implemented at Liferay. You will get a good understanding of how to deliver high quality solutions to market fast, while reducing the risk of the deployment process.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Continuous Delivery is the ability to get changes into the hands of users, safely and quickly in a sustainable way. This session will walk you through the benefits of automating software deployment into production. It will introduce the principles and practices that enable Continuous Delivery, and will describe how they are being implemented at Liferay. You will get a good understanding of how to deliver high quality solutions to market fast, while reducing the risk of the deployment process.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Hybrid support has been one of the most requested features since the early days of Liferay Screens, and it's finally here! In thisworkshop you'll learn how to reuse your web development (portlets, websites, portals) in your mobile apps, customize the UI to make it mobile-friendly and leverage all the features of truly native navigation, Cordova integration and much more.

Are you a web developer willing to build mobile apps with Liferay? Now it's your time!</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Hybrid support has been one of the most requested features since the early days of Liferay Screens, and it's finally here! In thisworkshop you'll learn how to reuse your web development (portlets, websites, portals) in your mobile apps, customize the UI to make it mobile-friendly and leverage all the features of truly native navigation, Cordova integration and much more.

Are you a web developer willing to build mobile apps with Liferay? Now it's your time!

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">With Liferay DXP, OSGI modularity was introduced. This kind of architecture is a natural fit for machine learning. At this talk, Piotr will introduce use cases and real life examples with Liferay and ML /AI integration, and present how end users can benefit from Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence soutions on Liferay. The credo of this talk is: Think modular, think AI.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In this talk I’ll create a fully automated publishing platform by using auto-tagging based on business rules and the asset publisher. We all know that tagging content and documents takes discipline and humans are lazy, sloppy and/or busy. Get maximum value out of the Liferay tagging mechanism with a little help from our friend Elasticsearch. In about 30 minutes you will learn how to take advantage of Liferay DXP and Liferay Enterprise Search.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: In this talk I’ll create a fully automated publishing platform by using auto-tagging based on business rules and the asset publisher. We all know that tagging content and documents takes discipline and humans are lazy, sloppy and/or busy. Get maximum value out of the Liferay tagging mechanism with a little help from our friend Elasticsearch. In about 30 minutes you will learn how to take advantage of Liferay DXP and Liferay Enterprise Search.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">More than 10 years ago, Liferay introduced an innovative way to build websites by reusing portlet technology. Thanks to this idea, site administrators could create pages by combining small pieces (the portlets) into a layout. This provided much more flexibility than most site creators at the time and allowed seamless integration of content and applications.

Fast forward to 2017 and sites look very different nowadays. Today most modern sites pay a lot of attention to visual detail, have very flexible layouts, feature multiple menus and it’s common to see very long pages, specially in front pages and landing pages. Liferay DXP is very flexible and has been able to accommodate these new trends, however sometimes this is only leveraged by people with strong knowledge of Liferay and it’s out of reach for others. 

So we have decided to spend some time finding an answer to the question “If we were to invent the best platform to build modern sites, pages and content today, what would it look like?”. The result of this thought process is a project we call “Modern Site Building” which aims to reinvent the Liferay Web Experience capabilities. In this session we will share all about it.</Description></root>

Fast forward to 2017 and sites look very different nowadays. Today most modern sites pay a lot of attention to visual detail, have very flexible layouts, feature multiple menus and it’s common to see very long pages, specially in front pages and landing pages. Liferay DXP is very flexible and has been able to accommodate these new trends, however sometimes this is only leveraged by people with strong knowledge of Liferay and it’s out of reach for others. 

So we have decided to spend some time finding an answer to the question “If we were to invent the best platform to build modern sites, pages and content today, what would it look like?”. The result of this thought process is a project we call “Modern Site Building” which aims to reinvent the Liferay Web Experience capabilities. In this session we will share all about it.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">The OSGi-based, modular architecture of Liferay DXP demands for adaptation in software design, development, and operations. The so-called Liferay Workspace provides a good starting point to address the corresponding topics. Development support is based on Gradle in general and a special plugin to address Liferay-specifics. Beyond development topics, Liferay Workspace also integrates aspects of configuration management, for instance, to maintain stage specific settings. In combination, development and operations aspects are manageable in an integrated way based on the Liferay workspace. Starting with that workspace, we will give an overview of experiences made during the last year of working with Liferay DXP. Based on those experiences, we will sketch extensions of the Liferay Workspace which support the integration of further topics like development infrastructures based on Vagrant, credential management, integration of Liferay sources, management of non-OSGi development artifacts, and assembly types for deployment. On top of this blueprint, we will provide an overview of its integration with the overall development and operations infrastructure. We will conclude with an outline of release- and deployment management and the applied tool chain.</Description></root>

We will conclude with an outline of release- and deployment management and the applied tool chain.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jens is Managing IT-Consultant and Lead Architect at PRODYNA. He is working with Liferay since version 5.2.3. He is working with Liferay DXP since its release and developed tools and plugins for the platform which are applied in various projects. As Lead Architect he is responsible to coordinate technical exchange among Liferay-related projects at PRODYNA and the company-wide implementation of standards and tools for portal projects. Jens is also the author of NABUCCO Script Center and a regular speaker at past DEVCONs.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Karen Levy Newnam, Liferay's director of partner marketing, is a 15-year veteran of the IT channel who specializes in channel marketing, sales and operations development and infrastructure. 

In her role, Karen is responsible for mapping the direction of the company's global channel marketing strategy and for managing partner marketing worldwide.  

With experience from the partner, vendor and marketing services sides of the industry, Karen brings a unique perspective to Liferay's channel program. 

Karen’s diverse background includes tenure in the entertainment and advertising industries as well as eight years as an adjunct professor in public higher education.

In her spare time, Karen enjoys endurance running and laughing yoga.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Join this interview style keynote to hear Dr. Tony Murphy dig into NASA’s campaign to create “citizen scientists” during the recent solar eclipse. The interview will be moderated by Karen Newnam.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Join this interview style keynote to hear Dr. Tony Murphy dig into NASA’s campaign to create “citizen scientists” during the recent solar eclipse. The interview will be moderated by Karen Newnam.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Dr. Anthony (Tony) Murphy is director of The Global Learning and Observations to Benefit the Environment (GLOBE) Program Implementation Office (GIO) and is internationally known for his work in STEM education. Previously, Murphy served as Founding and Executive Director of the National Center for STEM Elementary Education at St. Catherine University in St. Paul, Minnesota.

Tony is proud of his association with the GLOBE Program, he first served the GLOBE Program at the White House in 1995. He notes that "Being involved at the ground level and working with scientists to create materials that would be used by teachers and students nationwide and globally was an incredible opportunity." Tony also served as a GLOBE education and training coordinator and received a promotion to deputy assistant director. "This was one of the most innovative programs at the time and having students, teachers and scientists working together on this type of science and education project was incredibly powerful." Twenty years on, it is amazing to see how far the Program has come and how far it is yet to go.

Join Dr. Tony Murphy's keynote to hear about NASA’s campaign to create “citizen scientists” during the recent solar eclipse.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">What does Digital Transformation actually look like? In this session we will share about how a collaboration between teams at Liferay evolved into a new product. The end result was a one thousand fold increase in Testing team productivity—all while increasing test coverage and throughput. This session will introduce you to some of the common Testing and Development problems we faced at Liferay, how the product we built solved those problems and a demo to attendees of the product in action.</Description></root>

The end result was a one thousand fold increase in Testing team productivity—all while increasing test coverage and throughput. This session will introduce you to some of the common Testing and Development problems we faced at Liferay, how the product we built solved those problems and a demo to attendees of the product in action.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">JR Houn has been in the testing industry for almost a decade and is one of the founding team members for the Quality Assurance team at Liferay, Inc. His greatest passion is to bring empathy, understanding, vision, and excellence to both the SDLC and the teams that make great software possible. When JR isn't mulling over the next five steps for quality at Liferay, he enjoys hiking, video games, playing guitar, and spending time with his wife and two year old daughter.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Over the last few years we've seen an increase in the importance of APIs in connecting systems internally and also in providing services to 3rd party developers, creating what is known as the API economy. This approach provides many benefits, but also interesting challenges. 

In this session we will present some key improvements we are making to the Liferay platform to help solve these challenges. We will introduce a new breed of Web APIs that we are developing with a focus on security and evolvability. The goal is not only to make it possible to access the functionality on the platform from Mobile Apps, Microservices or IoT devices, but to design them in such a way that new features can be introduced over time without breaking this external system. We will even review some tricks to make them able to learn new features without any code changes.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Over the last few years we've seen an increase in the importance of APIs in connecting systems internally and also in providing services to 3rd party developers, creating what is known as the API economy. This approach provides many benefits, but also interesting challenges.

We will introduce a new breed of Web APIs that we are developing with a focus on security and evolvability. The goal is not only to make it possible to access the functionality on the platform from Mobile Apps, Microservices or IoT devices, but to design them in such a way that new features can be introduced over time without breaking this external system. We will even review some tricks to make them able to learn new features without any code changes.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Liferay can talk the talk. But can Liferay walk the walk? A formidable challenge for companies undertaking digital transformation is cutting across information silos. Liferay is no exception. Liferay works with thousands of enterprises across the world, generating data through marketing, sales, support and operations. All this information needs to come together and be available to departmental teams so that we can engage our customers personally and intelligently. We’ll share our experiences and lessons learned as we tackle our own data silo challenges. We’ll also discuss next steps that focus on harnessing this information to support a fuller understanding of our customers and develop actionable metrics.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Liferay can talk the talk. But can Liferay walk the walk? We’ll share our experiences and lessons learned as we tackle our own data silo challenges. We’ll also discuss next steps that focus on harnessing this information to support a fuller understanding of our customers and develop actionable metrics.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Smith & Nephew is transforming healthcare delivery through its unique interactive digital solutions designed to help hospitals and surgeons reduce cost by increasing OR efficiency. To deliver maximum value, Smith & Nephew needed a flexible, future-ready platform to build its S2 Procedure Performance application, which is designed to document and train OR staff on how to set up surgical tables for specific procedures and doctors.

In this session, Smith & Nephew will share its story, challenges, and lessons learned throughout their journey to create a connected care platform for the future. Learn how the Liferay based solution is enabling Smith & Nephew to deliver a much-enhanced user experience through a personalized training environment that has not only decreased training time and made the process more enjoyable through gamification but has also helped hospitals reduce costs through analytics on instrument utilization.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Smith & Nephew is transforming healthcare delivery through its unique interactive digital solutions designed to help hospitals and surgeons reduce cost by increasing OR efficiency. To deliver maximum value, Smith & Nephew needed a flexible, future-ready platform to build its S2 Procedure Performance application, which is designed to document and train OR staff on how to set up surgical tables for specific procedures and doctors.

In this session, Smith & Nephew will share its story, challenges, and lessons learned throughout their journey to create a connected care platform for the future. Learn how the Liferay based solution is enabling Smith & Nephew to deliver a much-enhanced user experience through a personalized training environment that has not only decreased training time and made the process more enjoyable through gamification but has also helped hospitals reduce costs through analytics on instrument utilization.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US"><i>A Customer-Centric Approach to Implementing Effective Digital Business Strategies</i>

Digital transformation requires substantial investment in the often nebulous field of design. Aligning the business, design and development teams is demanding but critical to operational success. We’ll discuss some misconceptions about “design,” learn why focusing on customers is fundamental to organizational growth, and how design helps you achieve that. We’ll discuss steps to improve the process and end results that can be used for building anything from a simple site to a complex intranet.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: A Customer-Centric Approach to Implementing Effective Digital Business Strategies Digital transformation requires substantial investment in the often nebulous field of design. Aligning the business, design and development teams is demanding but critical to operational success. We’ll discuss some misconceptions about “design,” learn why focusing on customers is fundamental to organizational growth, and how design helps you achieve that. We’ll discuss steps to improve the process and end results that can be used for building anything from a simple site to a complex intranet.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In today's software development lifecycle, full spectrum testing is a given. But what's the best way to test with the latest development tools in Liferay DXP? Come to this workshop and gain real world experience writing tests for DXP apps from start to finish. In this workshop you will learn:

- How to setup a new Liferay DXP dev environment using Blade and Developer Studio
- How to configure Liferay Workspace with your target platform
- How to test your Liferay extensions with a leading mocking framework
- How to test your new services with Liferay's integration testing framework
- How to test your front-end portlets using a BDD testing framework</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
In today's software development lifecycle, full spectrum testing is a given. But what's the best way to test with the latest development tools in Liferay DXP? Come to this workshop and gain real world experience writing tests for DXP apps from start to finish. In this workshop you will learn:

- How to setup a new Liferay DXP dev environment using Blade and Developer Studio
- How to configure Liferay Workspace with your target platform
- How to test your Liferay extensions with a leading mocking framework
- How to test your new services with Liferay's integration testing framework
- How to test your front-end portlets using a BDD testing framework

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">There are many perspectives on what a Single Customer View is (and isn’t), and one of the most common misconceptions is that an SCV is either a piece of software or an off-the-shelf product. The Single Customer View is not only a product but is in fact a process that your data must follow to make it ready and suitable for marketing, analytics and insight. It is a state of mind. Through the extraction, transformation and load process, the SCV should take all the data you hold about your customers on an automated journey of matching, cleansing and enhancement.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: There are many perspectives on what a Single Customer View is (and isn’t), and one of the most common misconceptions is that an SCV is either a piece of software or an off-the-shelf product. The Single Customer View is not only a product but is in fact a process that your data must follow to make it ready and suitable for marketing, analytics and insight. It is a state of mind. Through the extraction, transformation and load process, the SCV should take all the data you hold about your customers on an automated journey of matching, cleansing and enhancement.

Jonathan eventually joined product management team in 2016 and is in charge of Products such as Single Customer View and Campaign Manager.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Liferay DXP is built using a philosophy of "secure by design," but this doesn't mean all the work is done for you. The attack surface for a Liferay implementation certainly involves the platform itself but can be unintentionally and sometimes significantly increased by external integration points and custom development. This session will provide an overview of the tools and techniques you can use to secure your platform implementation and discuss how to best prevent and detect any intrusions into your mission critical applications.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Liferay DXP is built using a philosophy of "secure by design," but this doesn't mean all the work is done for you. The attack surface for a Liferay implementation certainly involves the platform itself but can be unintentionally and sometimes significantly increased by external integration points and custom development. This session will provide an overview of the tools and techniques you can use to secure your platform implementation and discuss how to best prevent and detect any intrusions into your mission critical applications.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nathan Shaw is a Principal Consultant with Liferay, Inc. and joined Liferay in 2010 after developing enterprise applications based on the Liferay platform for many years. He has a background in physics but has been applying his analytical skills as a software engineer and architect for over a decade. He is based in the fine state of Ohio and enjoys working directly with key clients and partners in his role with Liferay Consulting. Nathan holds a B.S. in Physics from Hope College and a Ph.D. in Experimental Nuclear Physics from Stony Brook University.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In the world of web development, things are always changing. The first portlet specification came out in October 2003 and, as one would expect, things have changed since then. With that in mind, we are proposing a new way of developing portlets that we think will add a lot of value for those wanting faster development speed, improved user experience with lightning fast navigations and state of the art technology like ES6 and Hybrid Rendering (isomorphic rendering). Come join us to see how SoyPortlet, Senna.js and Metal.js come together to provide a better experience for both developers and users.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: In the world of web development, things are always changing. The first portlet specification came out in October 2003 and, as one would expect, things have changed since then. With that in mind, we are proposing a new way of developing portlets that we think will add a lot of value for those wanting faster development speed, improved user experience with lightning fast navigations and state of the art technology like ES6 and Hybrid Rendering (isomorphic rendering). Come join us to see how SoyPortlet, Senna.js and Metal.js come together to provide a better experience for both developers and users.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Starting with a robust underlying platform allowed us to focus on value add customer functionality from the start of the project. sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">With the explosion of content, it’s no longer sufficient to wait for users to search for information and receive “dumb” updates. Discover how Liferay DXP is solving the problem of getting the right information to the right people using search engine technologies. In this session, we will discuss how search technologies form the foundation of many machine learning algorithms. We will also show upcoming Liferay features that will greatly improve how your users will leverage search within the platform.</Description></root>

In this session, we will discuss how search technologies form the foundation of many machine learning algorithms. We will also show upcoming Liferay features that will greatly improve how your users will leverage search within the platform.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">This session will focus on the use case and architecture for a customer portal for one of the largest energy utilities in the U.S. with over 1.7 millions customers. This dynamic and flexible portal allows customers to view, pay, and manage their gas account - all with the complexity of integrating with 2 different Customer Information Systems - SAP and Oracle Customer Care & Billing, 3 payment providers and more.  In this implementation, XTIVIA leveraged Liferay DXP’s core features along with a modern Angular2 Single Page Application (SPA) architecture.  Additionally, we used XTIVIA’s Speedray architecture pattern to expedite software development and Service Guard for DXP to secure restful APIs by integrating with Liferay’s Role Based Access Control (RBAC) infrastructure.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: This session will focus on the use case and architecture for a customer portal for one of the largest energy utilities in the U.S. with over 1.7 millions customers. This dynamic and flexible portal allows customers to view, pay, and manage their gas account - all with the complexity of integrating with 2 different Customer Information Systems - SAP and Oracle Customer Care & Billing, 3 payment providers and more.  In this implementation, XTIVIA leveraged Liferay DXP’s core features along with a modern Angular2 Single Page Application (SPA) architecture.  Additionally, we used XTIVIA’s Speedray architecture pattern to expedite software development and Service Guard for DXP to secure restful APIs by integrating with Liferay’s Role Based Access Control (RBAC) infrastructure.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Matt Wolinski is a Senior Enterprise Portal Architect at XTIVIA, with extensive experience in a variety of enterprise software systems. He specializes in architecture, design, and development of highly concurrent enterprise class applications. Matt has worked on high traffic Web/Liferay applications with millions of users handling millions of page views per day. He takes a pragmatic approach to designing and developing systems that handle the necessary requirements and performance objectives without over-complicating the technical design. Matt has a proven ability to work with business owners to determine requirements and simplify technical jargon in creating complete solutions.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">A recent upgrade by Nashville, TN based Hospital Corporation of America (HCA), one of the leading providers of healthcare services in the U.S and U.K., from Liferay 6.1 to DXP provided meaningful and comprehensive tools that were used to consistently brand 600+ intranet sites, enhance social activities through blogging and message boards, replace survey tools with forms, and go mobile – a big project that is delivering big dividends. Hear from Michael Goldstein, who has been on the frontline of the upgrade.  He brings a unique perspective to any discussion on internal collaboration tools and processes that the Liferay audience needs to anticipate and understand.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: A recent upgrade by Nashville, TN based Hospital Corporation of America (HCA), one of the leading providers of healthcare services in the U.S and U.K., from Liferay 6.1 to DXP provided meaningful and comprehensive tools that were used to consistently brand 600+ intranet sites, enhance social activities through blogging and message boards, replace survey tools with forms, and go mobile – a big project that is delivering big dividends. Hear from Michael Goldstein, who has been on the frontline of the upgrade.  He brings a unique perspective to any discussion on internal collaboration tools and processes that the Liferay audience needs to anticipate and understand.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Michael Goldstein is Manager of Collaboration, Development Technologies for Nashville, TN based Hospital Corporation of America (HCA).  Michael develops and leads a team of software developers, business analysts, and product advocates that develop and support the adoption of HCA’s corporate intranet.
Throughout his career with HCA, he has held various leadership roles of increasing complexity and responsibility that include application engineering positions. 
A healthcare technology veteran, prior to joining HCA, Michael spent time with Narus Health in information security and other IT roles.
Mr. Goldstein holds an undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Tennessee, and an MBA from Vanderbilt University – Owen Graduate School of Management.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Content is viewed on all sorts of devices these days, which all have different screen sizes, bandwidths, processing capabilities, etc. Adaptive Media is a new application for Liferay DXP that delivers your media content in the best format, based on the channel and device that will consume it. This provides faster loading times, saves bandwidth and gives you administrative control over the image quality. Learn how this new tool integrates with other Liferay applications and how to use it with any device via a powerful and simple API.</Description></root>

At Liferay, Igor works as a Sr. Principal Consultant helping clients from various industries design, develop, integrate and optimize their software applications. Many of those clients have been actively moving to Liferay’s new OSGi-based platform, and Igor is helping them architect scalable modular applications.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US"><i>TSA Instagram: Inform, Educate, Entertain and Rock</i>

How is it that a government Instagram account could be ranked the 4th best account to follow by Rolling Stone? Great content is an obvious answer, but even when you have great content, you have to know how to use it. In 2015, over 700 million travelers were screened at TSA checkpoints. It’s mission critical to be able to keep these travelers informed and educated about TSA policy and procedures before they get to the checkpoint. Learn how TSA blogger and social media specialist, Bob Burns (AKA Blogger Bob), puts TSA’s photographic content to good use and is able to inform and educate TSA’s followers while also entertaining them enough to make them stick around for more.

1.	How does TSA use photographic content to educate, yet entertain its followers? 
2.	How can you change the conversation about your brand?
3.	Could your organization benefit from an Instagram account?</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Bob Burns is a Public Affairs Specialist and Social Media Lead. He joined the Transportation Security Administration’s (TSA) public affairs team in 2008 to help launch the agency’s social media presence. Known in some circles as “Blogger Bob,” he has become the face of TSA’s social media presence. Bob offers tips for getting through the checkpoint faster, commenting on stories in the press, or investigating and providing insights into “why” TSA has certain policies performs and procedures. His posts contain the perfect mix of fact and funny – artfully conveying important information in an entertaining fashion. Bob does an excellent job of leveraging his experience, personality, creativity, motivation, and commitment to help transform open government from promise to practice. Among many other accolades, Bob won a PRSA Bronze Anvil award in 2010 for the best blog campaign and Bob was recognized by the Washingtonian Magazine as one of Washington DC’s top 100 Tech Titans in 2011. Most recently, the TSA Instagram account was named the 4th best account to follow by Rolling Stone.

Bob's keynote will share the TSA’s successful strategy of using social content to help shape brand perception.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Based on a 2015 study conducted by Pew Research Center, 93% of American adults say that being in control of who can get information about them is important. In the digital age, where the number of sources to find private information of users is increasing exponentially, privacy has become a critical component for all users. While evaluating a platform on the premise of security, privacy has become a regular topic of conversation. 

Liferay as a platform offers robust security to protect applications from various kinds of known security attacks. From a privacy standpoint, the role based permission framework ensures that users only see information that is relevant to their defined role. An administrator or power user oversees the entire application while various roles carry activities defined within the system. 

In Private Corner, we wish to tune Liferay’s role based permission framework “up to eleven”. We intend to design a component that allows users to configure assets (documents, web content, personal information etc.) they want to make private. The assets would be beyond purview of everyone including the admin/power user.   

An administrator seeking to access private information would have a raise a request to that particular user. The objective of the demo is to showcase how users can turn their Liferay applications into private vaults to secure important classified information even from the application administrator.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Proper testing is crucial in achieving business transformation. In Liferay QA, we have learned many lessons about writing automated functional tests to maximize development speed and business value. Manual testing can be very costly and automated functional testing can be a black box to your Product Managers and Stakeholders. In this session we share a framework that can get you automating tests in 15 minutes using Cucumber and Ruby. Transform your testing and get your DXP project up and running on time with insight and strategies from a senior Liferay QA Test Engineer.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Upgrades are hard; let's not mince words. However, upgrades don't have to be so unpredictable and risky. When moving to Liferay DXP, people have many questions about the upgrade experience: how much work is involved, how much of what I know now do I have to throw away, how many new technologies do I have to learn? The questions that mount seem daunting. Therefore, we want you to come to this presentation to learn about some tools built specifically with the purpose of answering these questions. If you want to upgrade to DXP from Liferay 6.1 or 6.2, we will demonstrate how using these tools can help you estimate the amount of code that needs to be changed, which extension points have been deprecated or removed, how to migrate to new APIs and how to either continue to use existing frameworks you have already been using or leverage new modularity features in DXP. Let us help you breathe a little easier and not get your heart rate up so high the next time you consider upgrading to DXP.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Henry Nakamura joined Liferay as its first Customer Experience Manager and works to put the customer's needs first and build Liferay's Customer Experience Department. sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">From the very beginning, WeDeploy used Docker to isolate its workloads and provide a great way for developing microservices locally. As it got more and more mature, WeDeploy increased the usage of container technologies. In this talk we will go through some lessons learned running Docker in production across multiple machines, configurations and more than five thousand deployed services.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: From the very beginning, WeDeploy used Docker to isolate its workloads and provide a great way for developing microservices locally. As it got more and more mature, WeDeploy increased the usage of container technologies. In this talk we will go through some lessons learned running Docker in production across multiple machines, configurations and more than five thousand deployed services.

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">This presentation will provide an in-depth look at the new Portlet 3.0 standard from the JCP. Developers will learn how to create a new portlet from a Maven archetype and start taking advantage of the new features in the Portlet API. They will learn how to specify Resource Dependencies, use Explicit Render State, and use CDI to @Inject beans annotated with new portlet scopes. In addition, they will learn how to create a Single Page Application (SPA) via the Portlet Hub JavaScript API and XMLHttpRequest. Finally, they will learn how the JSR 378 FacesBridge makes it possible to deploy a JSF web application as a portlet with little-to-no modification.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: This presentation will provide an in-depth look at the new Portlet 3.0 standard from the JCP. Developers will learn how to create a new portlet from a Maven archetype and start taking advantage of the new features in the Portlet API. They will learn how to specify Resource Dependencies, use Explicit Render State, and use CDI to @Inject beans annotated with new portlet scopes. In addition, they will learn how to create a Single Page Application (SPA) via the Portlet Hub JavaScript API and XMLHttpRequest. Finally, they will learn how the JSR 378 FacesBridge makes it possible to deploy a JSF web application as a portlet with little-to-no modification.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Neil is a Software Architect for Liferay and is the project lead for Liferay Faces. Neil has over 20 years of experience in software engineering and represents the company as the Specification Lead on JSR 378 (Portlet 3.0 Bridge for JSF 2.2). He also represents Liferay on JSR 362 (Portlet 3.0), JSR 369 (Servlet 4.0), JSR 371 (MVC 1.0), and JSR 372 (JSF 2.3). Neil is a contributing author to the JSF 2.0 Complete Reference, published by McGraw-Hill.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Neil is a Software Architect for Liferay and is the project lead for Liferay Faces. Neil has over 20 years of experience in software engineering and represents the company as the Specification Lead on JSR 378 (Portlet 3.0 Bridge for JSF 2.2). sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Even the most established corporations are drawn to the potential value of enterprise social networks for their digital workspace, and there's no shortage of options out there. Yet instead of delivering richer collaboration and employee engagement, social networks often add more noise and fail to gain widespread adoption. Gain insights from Liferay's own journey in building a homegrown social networking app to align and engage our growing employee base.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Even the most established corporations are drawn to the potential value of enterprise social networks for their digital workspace, and there's no shortage of options out there. Yet instead of delivering richer collaboration and employee engagement, social networks often add more noise and fail to gain widespread adoption. Gain insights from Liferay's own journey in building a homegrown social networking app to align and engage our growing employee base.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Dennis recently transitioned into product management after six years as a software engineer at Liferay, Inc. Having faced the technical challenges of writing good code, he is now redirecting his efforts to building good products that matter to people. Dennis is passionate about Liferay's vision to help people reach their full potential to serve others. He also serves as the executive director for Liferay's nonprofit foundation. Dennis graduated with a B.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">The drive to create more personalized experiences on websites can sometimes have unintended side effects, such as negatively impacting your SEO. Learn how to maintain good SEO while creating a personalized website, as well as technical approaches to avoiding common mistakes that hurt your search rankings.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: The drive to create more personalized experiences on websites can sometimes have unintended side effects, such as negatively impacting your SEO. marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ryan Schuhler is a UI Software Engineer who works as the lead UI architect for Liferay's Web Team. He works on Liferay.com and all its sub sites, maintaining the front-end code that goes into it as well as dabbling in the back-end. Day to day he works on anything from coding solutions for marketing's needs and strategies to building microsites for events (like this site). Ryan has an appreciation for cleanliness and efficiency when it comes to both code and user experience and is passionate about seeing these things implemented on liferay.com. He loves the unique opportunity to both use and contribute to Liferay's product and can see, first-hand, the benefits of having a well-developed, flexible website platform.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Hearst Inc. operates over 360 separate businesses through seven major divisions, and is actively acquiring and integrating new businesses into the portfolio. Hearst wanted one place where all of their 20K employees could go to receive both a distinctive branded experience but also one that was tailored to each business and location. Liferay offered a platform that could deliver on both of these objectives. This session will talk about how we leveraged the core capabilities of Liferay to deliver both a consistent and differentiated experience to Hearst employees on a highly compressed timeline using modern development tools and processes.</Description></root>

This session will talk about how we leveraged the core capabilities of Liferay to deliver both a consistent and differentiated experience to Hearst employees on a highly compressed timeline using modern development tools and processes.

sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Susan will be speaking about the power of the potential when a community comes together to create change in the foster care system.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Susan Ramirez founded Austin Angels in 2010 while working for the second largest homebuilder in the nation as a certified field trainer. Susan was nationally ranked as a top performing sales agent and was responsible for hiring, training and developing new hires. While working long hours in corporate America Susan felt a higher calling to lead her community in service and thus made a change in her career in 2015 to solely focus on moving the mission forward. Susan has a strong acumen for leadership development and executing nonprofit strategies and tactics. Susan believes that every child growing up in the foster care system should have the ability to reach their fullest potential. Susan’s dream is to have a chapter in every major metropolitan city across the nation and will not stop until every child is reached.

Susan's talk will show the power of community to create meaningful change in the local foster care system.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">With the global rise of the digital connection economy, disruptors win, while established players (sometimes hastily) rebuild or connect their once state-of-the-art digital channels. The hope is not to just keep up but somehow create lasting momentum in order leap ahead of the competition. This presentation will suggest proven principles which have the power to create great customer experiences which facilitate satisfaction, loyalty, and trust. It contains specific actions steps for decision-makers, whether just starting on this journey or looking for next strategic steps.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Edmund es el responsable de Marketing y PR de Liferay en EMEA. Su principal actividad es la implementación de la estrategia de marketing en los mercados ya establecidos y los potenciales. Lleva 18 años trabajando con comunicación B2B, producción de media y marketing digital, tanto en grandes empresas como en instituciones sin ánimo de lucro. Edmund vive y trabaja en Frankfurt am Mein, Alemania.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Carolina Moreno inició en el año 2000 su carrera en la operadora internacional Vodafone, donde trabajó durante varios años en distintos departamentos del área de ingeniería. A partir de 2005, su pasión por la tecnología como clave de transformación la llevó a coordinar diversos proyectos tecnológicos, tanto nacionales como internacionales, relacionados con la aplicación del software libre como motor de desarrollo económico y social. Durante este periodo, Moreno ejerció también como profesora asociada en el Grupo de Sistemas y Comunicaciones de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de Madrid, uno de los departamentos universitarios que, a través de su grupo Libresoft, es puntero en España en el estudio, difusión y desarrollo de proyectos Open Source. En 2009 entró a formar parte de Liferay, para ocupar el puesto de directora de desarrollo de negocio en Liferay España y Portugal. En 2012 asumió la Dirección General para este territorio y desde 2015, la Dirección General del Sur de Europa.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Liferay DXP: Make Real Transformation Happen

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jorge hablará sobre los principales desarrollos que se están llevando a cabo en Liferay y que se darán a conocer a los largo de los dos días del Symposium. Entre otras cosas, presentará nuestro nuevo innovador enfoque para empoderar y ayudar a mejorar la coordinación de desarrolladores front-end, diseñadores y marketing a la hora de crear y mantener sitios web modernos perfectos al píxel, novedades muy emocionantes sobre APIs; los avances realizados hacia una analítica más personal además de los progresos en WeDeploy, y las mejores prácticas para implementar Liferay DXP en la nube.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: Jorge hablará sobre los principales desarrollos que se están llevando a cabo en Liferay y que se darán a conocer a los largo de los dos días del Symposium. Entre otras cosas, presentará nuestro nuevo innovador enfoque para empoderar y ayudar a mejorar la coordinación de desarrolladores front-end, diseñadores y marketing a la hora de crear y mantener sitios web modernos perfectos al píxel, novedades muy emocionantes sobre APIs; los avances realizados hacia una analítica más personal además de los progresos en WeDeploy, y las mejores prácticas para implementar Liferay DXP en la nube.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jorge is VP of Engineering at Liferay. He has a passion in bringing technology closer to users as a way to solve real world problems and add value to our society. He also believes that Open Source is a key driver to achieving it, since it's not only the most efficient way to build software but also most ethical way to deliver it.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Sergio trabaja como ingeniero de soporte en Liferay desde junio de 2011. Su actividad se centra en resolver cuestiones orientadas a sistemas e infraestructura. Además de su trabajo habitual en soporte, a través de los servicios profesionales de Liferay se encarga de optimizar el rendimiento de las instalaciones de los clientes efectuando de pruebas de rendimiento in-situ en sus instalaciones. Sus intereses también pasan por aspectos como las técnicas de mejora de posicionamiento en buscadores (SEO) y la seguridad. Sergio es graduado en Ingeniería Informática por la Universidad de Salamanca.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Proporcionar una experiencia unificada a tus clientes es una forma de hacer negocios. Si una organización ofrece una experiencia perfecta, personalizada y relevante para el cliente, sin importar dónde tenga lugar la interacción - Ventas, Soporte, Servicio al Cliente - o si la interacción se realiza por teléfono, móvil o web, generará confianza y ayudará a fidelizar al cliente. En esta sesión veremos cómo la tecnología puede ayudar a construir una experiencia unificada para cualquier canal y cómo la movilidad es clave en el mundo actual. 

Durante la exposición se mostrarán dos casos de reales que se completan con las dos sesiones siguientes de casos de uso de proyectos de Sector Público y Banca. ¡No te las pierdas tampoco!</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Proporcionar una experiencia unificada a tus clientes es una forma de hacer negocios. Si una organización ofrece una experiencia perfecta, personalizada y relevante para el cliente, sin importar dónde tenga lugar la interacción - Ventas, Soporte, Servicio al Cliente - o si la interacción se realiza por teléfono, móvil o web, generará confianza y ayudará a fidelizar al cliente. En esta sesión veremos cómo la tecnología puede ayudar a construir una experiencia unificada para cualquier canal y cómo la movilidad es clave en el mundo actual. 

Durante la exposición se mostrarán dos casos de reales que se completan con las dos sesiones siguientes de casos de uso de proyectos de Sector Público y Banca. ¡No te las pierdas tampoco!

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel lleva más de 15 años desarrollando productos de software para móviles, siendo CTO, director de desarrollo o arquitecto líder en distintas startup españolas y norteamericanas. En este tiempo, ha desarrollado desde herramientas de desarrollo, algoritmos de indexación y búsqueda para bases de datos textuales, software para tarjetas criptográficas, o juegos y aplicaciones desde los antiguos teléfonos Java. Desde su llegada a Liferay, lidera el equipo de Liferay Screens, desarrollando la siguiente generación de herramientas para desarrollo rápido de aplicaciones móviles. En su tiempo libre, José Manuel es profesor asociado en el máster de informática móvil y tarjetas inteligentes de la Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Rafa ha estado trabajando como un consultor de Liferay desde mayo de 2016. Sus principales actividades son preventa de producto, formador oficial en Liferay y prestación de servicios profesionales a los clientes. Anteriormente ha trabajado en una consultora dónde participaba en todas las diferentes fases del IT: desarrollo, análisis, gestión de proyecto y preventa; todo especializado en aplicaciones web o CMS. Rafa está graduado en Ingeniería de Software en la Universidad de Nebrija.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">El canal público de Avantcard ofrece información acerca de sus productos financieros, así como mecanismos de contratación a potenciales clientes interesados en dichos productos.
Además, internamente esta implantación ha facilitado a las áreas de comunicación de Avantcard la centralización sobre Liferay de la gestión de contenidos que son consumidos por el resto de canales de Avantcard (p.ej, el canal privado de clientes).
Gracias en general las capacidades OOTB de LIferay, y particularmente a sus  formularios y a sus facilidades de integración con los sistemas de CRM para los procesos de contratación, y a su API abierta sencillamente consumible que permitió compartir los contenidos con oros canales, el proyecto fue conceptualizado e implantado en 2 meses de proyecto.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Las actualizaciones siempre se ven como procesos largos y complejos. En esta charla, y en base a la experiencia acumulada a lo largo de todo este año, hablaremos de ciertos detalles y elementos que pueden hacernos cambiar esa perspectiva. Mostraremos soluciones a problemas comunes y técnicas para identificar sus causas y minimizar su impacto, y repasaremos las nuevas herramientas y recomendaciones para acelerar el proceso.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">En los últimos años hemos visto un aumento en la importancia de las APIs tanto en la conexión interna de sistemas así como en ofrecer servicios a desarrolladores de terceros, creando lo que se conoce como la economía de las API. Este enfoque ofrece muchos beneficios, aunque también desafíos interesantes. En esta sesión presentaremos algunas mejoras clave que estamos llevando a cabo en la plataforma Liferay para ayudar a resolver estos desafíos. Presentaremos una nueva generación de Web APIs que estamos desarrollando con un enfoque hacia la seguridad y capacidad de evolución. El objetivo no es solo permitir el acceso a funcionalidades de la plataforma a aplicaciones móviles, microservicios o dispositivos IoT, sino diseñarlas de tal manera que se puedan introducir nuevas características a lo largo del tiempo sin afectar a este sistema externo. Además revisaremos algunos trucos para que sean capaces de aprender nuevas funciones sin ningún cambio de código.</Description></root>

Este enfoque ofrece muchos beneficios, aunque también desafíos interesantes. En esta sesión presentaremos algunas mejoras clave que estamos llevando a cabo en la plataforma Liferay para ayudar a resolver estos desafíos. Presentaremos una nueva generación de Web APIs que estamos desarrollando con un enfoque hacia la seguridad y capacidad de evolución. El objetivo no es solo permitir el acceso a funcionalidades de la plataforma a aplicaciones móviles, microservicios o dispositivos IoT, sino diseñarlas de tal manera que se puedan introducir nuevas características a lo largo del tiempo sin afectar a este sistema externo. Además revisaremos algunos trucos para que sean capaces de aprender nuevas funciones sin ningún cambio de código.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">El reto para lograr una auténtica transformación en las organizaciones pasa, según los expertos, por fusionar las experiencias digitales con un profundo cambio operacional que permita acelerar la innovación y aportar a los clientes los servicios que demandan en cada momento. Es decir, para lograr una transformación 100% real las empresas tendrán que centrarse en al menos dos aspec-tos clave a la hora de elaborar su estrategia: Unificar las experiencias del cliente y transformar las operaciones de negocio. <br>
Junto con <b>mimacom, Fernando Carrión de Ricoh, David Olmos de Zylk y Mónica Lamas de SopraSteria</b> debatiremos sobre experiencias digitales omnicanal y la necesidad de transformación interna.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
El reto para lograr una auténtica transformación en las organizaciones pasa, según los expertos, por fusionar las experiencias digitales con un profundo cambio operacional que permita acelerar la innovación y aportar a los clientes los servicios que demandan en cada momento. Es decir, para lograr una transformación 100% real las empresas tendrán que centrarse en al menos dos aspec-tos clave a la hora de elaborar su estrategia: Unificar las experiencias del cliente y transformar las operaciones de negocio.
Junto con mimacom, Fernando Carrión de Ricoh, David Olmos de Zylk y Mónica Lamas de SopraSteria debatiremos sobre experiencias digitales omnicanal y la necesidad de transformación interna.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Desde marzo de 2015, Fernando Carrión es director del área de Desarrollo de negocios Digitales para Ricoh IT Services. Entre sus funciones se encontrará la consolidación de la estrategia de comunicación digital de la compañía. Por otra parte es el responsable en búsquedas de nuevas áreas de negocio digital.  
Carrión ha desarrollado su carrera profesional en empresas como Yahoo, Director de Planificación y Estrategia;  Microsoft Ibérica, dando soporte al departamento comercial así como al departamento de marketing; Recoletos Compañía Editorial; en Terra Lycos Latinoamérica y España; y en The Media Edge.
Fernando Carrión es Licenciado en Publicidad y Relaciones Públicas por el Colegio Universitario  Domingo de Soto en Segovia  (adscrito a la  Universidad Complutense de Madrid.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Codificar una gran web API no es fácil, debe ser eficiente, consistente, fácil de usar, y tiene que estar lista lo antes posible. Y cuando finalmente terminas y piensas que está todo hecho, evolucionarla puede resultar un desafío aún mayor.  Vulcan hace este proceso más simple, facilitando la creación de Web APIs y consumidores que están diseñados para evolucionar en el tiempo tantas veces como sea necesario -  sin control de versiones u otras molestias - mientras preserva las características de las grandes web APIs. 

Tanto si estás desarrollando las APIs, las aplicaciones móviles, o los microservicios que las consumen, prepárate para sorprenderte por las posibilidades de usar Hypermedia y vocabularios estándar en APIs.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue:
Codificar una gran web API no es fácil, debe ser eficiente, consistente, fácil de usar, y tiene que estar lista lo antes posible. Y cuando finalmente terminas y piensas que está todo hecho, evolucionarla puede resultar un desafío aún mayor.  Vulcan hace este proceso más simple, facilitando la creación de Web APIs y consumidores que están diseñados para evolucionar en el tiempo tantas veces como sea necesario -  sin control de versiones u otras molestias - mientras preserva las características de las grandes web APIs. 

Tanto si estás desarrollando las APIs, las aplicaciones móviles, o los microservicios que las consumen, prepárate para sorprenderte por las posibilidades de usar Hypermedia y vocabularios estándar en APIs.

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Lightning 2<br>

<b>Midiendo el éxito en proyectos Open Source. El caso de Liferay</b> por José Manrique López de la Fuente. A lo largo de los años hemos visto lo importante que es la transparencia y las métricas para mejorar el desarrollo de software de código abierto. Podría ser un signo de profesionalismo frente a artesanía en el desarrollo de software de código abierto y gestión de la comunidad. Pero, si no nos ocupamos de cómo usamos las métricas junto con la transparencia de código abierto, podríamos terminar yendo contra los objetivos de nuestro proyecto. Durante esta charla, describiremos cómo aplicar la metodología GQM (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GQM) a nuestros proyectos de desarrollo de software para tener un marco abierto, transparente y personalizado de &#34;mejora continua&#34; con algunos datos iniciales de la comunidad de Liferay. Como resultado, el software y los datos podrían ser utilizados por la comunidad de Liferay para investigación y sus propias necesidades.

<br><br>
Lightning 3<br>

<b>Haz más que seguimiento de estadísticas con Google Tag Manager en Liferay</b> por Fco. Javier García Ros. En la charla relámpago queremos contar nuestra experiencia en la Universidad de Murcia con el gestor de etiquetas Google Tag Manager (GTM) y cómo se integra con Liferay.  Tras una breve introducción a GTM mostraremos algunos de los casos de uso que estamos aplicando a la universidad, cómo se puede integrar GTM en Liferay así como mostrar otros casos de uso que puede ser de interés.

<br><br>
Lightning 4<br>

<b>Integración de Chatbot con Liferay</b> por Mónica Lamas.

<br><br>
Lightning 5<br>
<b>Experiencia de integración de fuentes de datos en el ecosistema de la organización</b> por Vicente Javier Rosselló. Cuando nos encontramos en un contexto en el que hay diversas fuentes de datos (Web, aplicaciones, ficheros offline, …) tenemos que integrar los datos de todas las fuentes para tener una visión real y más enriquecida para el usuario final. Integrar significa combinar datos que se encuentran en diferentes fuentes para permitirle al usuario final tener una vista unificada de los mismos para una accesibilidad idónea, que sirva a las necesidades de negocio. No integrar significaba tener dificultades, insatisfacción de la clientela, falta de confianza en la información, y a veces no cumplir con normativas de seguridad por la confiabilidad de los datos. Es interesante ver como en una organización universitaria se ha integrado diferentes conjuntos de información de diferentes orígenes y tipos (BBDD, REST, HTML, API Liferay) . Entre ellos destacan: las fichas de profesores con sus currículums y otros datos sociales de interés, los cursos de formación de para el personal generando páginas automatizadas de información, la presentación de bloques de datos de páginas definidas en aplicaciones con seguridad unificada en SSO, los listados de documentos de carpetas estructuradas, la integración de aplicaciones vía webproxy y la inclusión de aplicaciones de terceros por iframe.</Description></root>

Entre ellos destacan: las fichas de profesores con sus currículums y otros datos sociales de interés, los cursos de formación de para el personal generando páginas automatizadas de información, la presentación de bloques de datos de páginas definidas en aplicaciones con seguridad unificada en SSO, los listados de documentos de carpetas estructuradas, la integración de aplicaciones vía webproxy y la inclusión de aplicaciones de terceros por iframe.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Socio y gerente de negocios, marketing y alianzas en Bitergia y apasionado de las comunidades de código abierto.
 Después de graduarse como ingeniero industrial y de haber empezado el doctorado en informática, ha trabajado en el Centro Tecnológico de Informática y Comunicaciones del Principado de Asturias, participando en grupos de trabajo del W3C. Posteriormente director de innovación en Ándago Engineering, tras gestional el de innovación de área de salud y bienestar y ser co-responsable del grupo técnico de Continua Health Alliance.
 Después de un breve período como CEO de una start-up y como consultor especializado en proyectos empresariales relacionados con el mundo del software libre colaborando con CENATIC y ASOLIF se unió a Bitergia en 2013.
 Participante en varias comunidades relacionadas con el software libre como Maemo/Meego, Mozilla Madrid, Google Developers Group, etc.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">El soporte híbrido ha sido una de las funcionalidades más solicitadas desde los inicios de Liferay Screens, y finalmente está aquí. En esta charla explicaremos diferentes enfoques en el desarrollo de aplicaciones híbridas y las nuevas características introducidas en Liferay Screens en esta área.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel lleva más de 15 años desarrollando productos de software para móviles, siendo CTO, director de desarrollo o arquitecto líder en distintas startup españolas y norteamericanas. En este tiempo, ha desarrollado desde herramientas de desarrollo, algoritmos de indexación y búsqueda para bases de datos textuales, software para tarjetas criptográficas, o juegos y aplicaciones desde los antiguos teléfonos Java. Desde su llegada a Liferay, lidera el equipo de Liferay Screens, desarrollando la siguiente generación de herramientas para desarrollo rápido de aplicaciones móviles. En su tiempo libre, José Manuel es profesor asociado en el máster de informática móvil y tarjetas inteligentes de la Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca.</Description></root>

sessions.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">La transformación digital es un proceso que en muchas ocasiones comienza con proyectos internos. La tecnología y, en especial, las herramientas orientadas a formentar la colaboración y de gestión del conocimiento son clave no solo para construir entornos internos que rompan los silos de información y que repercuten de forma directa en el experience del cliente externo e interno, si no que ayudan a aumentar la productividad.

En esta sesión te daremos algunas clave de herramientas que ayudan a impulsar la colaboración. Además, con los dos casos reales posteriores de retail podrás recoger más ideas de entornos colaborativos. Te invitamos a que asistas también.</Description></root>

La transformación digital es un proceso que en muchas ocasiones comienza con proyectos internos. En esta sesión te daremos algunas clave de herramientas que ayudan a impulsar la colaboración. Además, con los dos casos reales posteriores de retail podrás recoger más ideas de entornos colaborativos. Te invitamos a que asistas también.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Javier Ahedo es consultor en Liferay, apoyando a la compañía realizando preventas y servicios profesionales. Ha trabajado desde el año 2005 en el mundo de las tecnologías opensource, desempeñando todos los roles desde programador a jefe de proyecto. Es Ingeniero Informático por Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca, además de tener un máster en la Escuela de Telecomunicaciones de la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Juan Gigli es argentino y licenciado en Ciencia Política. Se estableció en España en 2004 y a lo largo de estos años ha trabajado en diferentes empresas de marketing digital (Cabestan, CheetahDigital, Salesforce) especialmente en la disciplina del email marketing. En todos estos años ha gestionado exitosamente largos y complejos ciclos de ventas en el segmento empresarial en el mercado español en diferentes industrias. Posteriormente ha participado en proyectos en grandes integradores como Accenture o Capgemini. En marzo de 2017 se une a Liferay para impulsar el uso de esta plataforma en el mercado español y portugués.</Description></root>

La nueva intranet con Liferay DXP de Nueva Pescanova ofrece múltiples funcionalidades y fomenta la colaboración y el sentimiento de pertenencia gracias a una comunicación directa y personalizada con una experiencia de usuario excepcional.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Licenciada en Comunicación Audiovisual y en Periodismo por la Universidad de Navarra y PDD del IESE Business School, inicia su actividad profesional en 1997 como periodista en varios medios de comunicación, entre los que destacan El Mundo, The Miami Herald, Telecinco y Europa Press.
Tras cinco años como Directora de Comunicación de la Confederación de Empresarios de Pontevedra, en 2007 pone en marcha su propia compañía, MundiNova Consultores de Comunicación, referente del sector en el noroeste peninsular, desarrollando estrategias de comunicación corporativa y de producto, principalmente en áreas de consumo, banca, energía, tecnología y sectores empresariales. Lo compagina con la dirección del Portal Innovamás y del Anuario de la Innovación en Galicia. Desde abril de 2016 es la Directora de Comunicación de Nueva Pescanova.</Description></root>

sessions.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">A día de hoy, los contenidos se consumen en todo tipo de dispositivos, y están sujetos a diferentes tamaños de pantalla, anchos de banda, capacidades de procesamiento, etc. Sin embargo, hasta ahora el contenido multimedia se enviaba a los dispositivos sin tener en cuenta estas características. Adaptive Media es una nueva aplicación para Liferay DXP que te permitirá ofrecer tu contenido multimedia en el mejor formato, basado en el canal y el dispositivo que lo recibirá. Esto proporciona tiempos de carga más rápidos, ahorro de ancho de banda y también mayor control sobre la calidad de imagen enviada. Adaptive Media no sólo está totalmente integrado en las aplicaciones de Liferay, sino que también puede ser consumido y accedido por cualquier dispositivo a través de una potente y simple API.</Description></root>
sessions.descriptionCurrentValue: A día de hoy, los contenidos se consumen en todo tipo de dispositivos, y están sujetos a diferentes tamaños de pantalla, anchos de banda, capacidades de procesamiento, etc. Sin embargo, hasta ahora el contenido multimedia se enviaba a los dispositivos sin tener en cuenta estas características. Adaptive Media es una nueva aplicación para Liferay DXP que te permitirá ofrecer tu contenido multimedia en el mejor formato, basado en el canal y el dispositivo que lo recibirá. Esto proporciona tiempos de carga más rápidos, ahorro de ancho de banda y también mayor control sobre la calidad de imagen enviada. Adaptive Media no sólo está totalmente integrado en las aplicaciones de Liferay, sino que también puede ser consumido y accedido por cualquier dispositivo a través de una potente y simple API.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Sergio González trabaja en Liferay como Ingeniero Core en la oficina de Madrid desde 2010. Es el desarrollador responsable del Gestor de Documentos y Colaboración aunque también posee amplia experiencia en otras áreas de Liferay Portal. Además de sus tareas como desarrollador, también imparte cursos a desarrolladores por Europa. Sergio es Licenciado en Telecomunicaciones con un Máster en Ingeniería Informática por la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Iván es Ingeniero Informático por la Universidad Autónoma de Madrid y ha dedicado su carrera profesional al desarrollo de software, tanto formando parte de empresas, como siendo autónomo.

Su principal área profesional siempre fue Java, pero nunca ha dejado de lado el frontend ni el desarrollo móvil en sus ratos libres, razón por la que, en su nueva etapa en Liferay, ha decidido dar el salto profesional y convertirse en desarrollador de infraestructura front.

Actualmente se encarga del desarrollo de la infraestructura Javascript del portal, lo que incluye las herramientas de construcción de proyectos y el despliegue de código Javascript.</Description></root>
